Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - caution about leaving car on property”
Reviews.Author: Cheekywoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Double Tree for one night prior to departing for our March Break vacation. The hotel was fine, albeit a little dated, and as a Hilton Diamond member we had access to the executive lounge for cheese/crackers and appetizers, which were just OK. They have several on-site restaurants. We parked our car for the week, and it was a real upset to return and find that it had been broken into. The crooks had smashed the back window, and stolen the steering wheel airbag. (They make you park in a far parking area, away from the hotel. We made the mistake of parking up against the fence.) Needless to say, we won't stay here and leave a car again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TimfromTBay
Reviews.Content: My job has me travelling and staying in a variety of hotels in various cities but my favourite is always the Doubletree at the Toronto Airport. The rooms are beautiful, modern and very clean. The rates are the most reasonable rates around the airport. The beds are comfortable. The bathrooms are a good size. The restaurants offer excellent food at great prices. The staff and service is second to NONE - always pleasant and professional. We've used this hotel for meetings as well and they've always been able to accommodate my needs, even with little notice. The Business Travel staff, especially Pamela, have gone out of their way to make each stay or meeting flawless. Definitely the best at the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay & Park Option”
Reviews.Author: KevinFromCanada
Reviews.Content: Flying out of Toronto Pearson early? I highly recommend staying here the night before and leaving your car. Considering cost of other park & fly options, their package is very reasonable. Free shuttle runs every 30 minutes. Rooms are spacious and clean. Beds are very comfortable. My only complaint: I'm only 6' tall but shower nozzle was nose high. Otherwise great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need!!”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixRising7
Reviews.Content: The best part about the Doubletree is that it has most everything, and more, to fill ones needs. The gift shop, indoor swimming pool, roomy and equipped gym, 4 restaurants....i mean the list goes on. For Hilton HHonor members i especially appreciate the evening receptions on Wednesday nights and also the excellent food selections and service in the lounge on the 12th floor. The staff has always been courteous and so approachable for anything i've needed. I've been coming here each month for the past year, and i keep coming back cause of how much i have available to me at the hotel. Definitely worth the money!! :)

Reviews.Title: “My second home...”
Reviews.Author: soulmusiq
Reviews.Content: I'm a business traveler and this Doubltree has been my second home since May 2011. My room is a corner king on the street side of the hotel. The view is not much but better than the parking lot and powerlines on the other side. Over any long stay at one hotel you are bound to encounter some mishaps. Each time the entire staff has gone above and beyond to make sure my stay is comfortable. As for my room, (Pros) bed is comfortable, the TV is up to date, and very clean by hotel standards. (Cons) Not enough outlets by the bed, dark carpet, dated sofa and side chair. Resteraunts: Japanese, Chinanese, Italian, and the traditional hotel resteraunt. The breakfast buffet is really nice. But there are several other chain brand resteraunts within a 5 min drive. The hotel is close to the airport and Toronto convention centre, but getting downtown can be an experience. Overall I recommend this hotel. You can't beat the great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: dgumbine
Reviews.Content: I am a long term guest at thgsi Double Tree, will have been there a year in March and will be here about anotehr 2 years. I never check out of my room, so I keep everything here which makes travel a lot easier. The staff have made me one of the family! The GM, Sales Manager, Front Desk, Resteraunt staff, Bell Staff and everyone have been great. Very responsive to our needs. I recommend this hotel to anyone - both for personal and business travel. It has lots a family oriented items and its proximity to airport is great.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree by Hilton Toronto Airport”
Reviews.Author: tinman1950
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great hotel that makes you feel like you are at home this is the place you are looking for the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. I stay there for business and family trips both and the staff treat you like family they are there to make your stay comfortable from check in to check out. They have a great pool and work out area as well as spacious rooms. They have a great welcoming night on Wednesdays for their corporate clients so you get to know each other. There are restaurants with great food in the hotel as well as a bar or you can walk across the road to a half a dozen other places to eat. I would recommend this hotel for both their hospitality and convenience to Pearson International Airport and the easy access for those driving to highway 401.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, better service”
Reviews.Author: Joel M
Reviews.Content: With a great location near the airport and an excellent staff, I've been staying at this hotel for each of my Toronto visits. The staff goes out of their way to exceed your Hilton Honors expectations and does their best to ensure you feel at home. By far the best value in the Toronto airport area! I recommend this hotel for both business and casual travelers.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that makes you feel at home.”
Reviews.Author: kamyr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times when flying out of Toronto. They make you feel so welcome. That chocolate chip cookie upon check in is always warm. Nice touch. The staff is so helpful and friendly and the rooms are well kept. Rooms a clean, well stocked and the beds are comfy cozy! The shuttle runs every 30 minutes and you are always looked after to ensure a safe arrival to the airport. Thanks Doubletree for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A return visit!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaVirgi
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay here and that's because we so enjoyed our stay here last year. We usually have a very early flight so we come to Toronto the night before to save a really early morning drive - and we stay here at the Double Tree. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, room service is fast and hot when it arrives, and there is a free shuttle to and from the airport. On top of all this we can have our car stay here for the two weeks we are away for just the cost of our overnight stay. This hotel is clean, quiet and has the most wonderful beds! Over the years we have stayed at 6 other hotels in this area near the airport and this is the one we will always come back to! It is one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “good choice for airport stopover”
Reviews.Author: bruce14
Reviews.Content: Large hotel with pleasant standard size rooms, usually offers a reasonable deal for leaving your car while on holiday, efficient shuttle service to and from the airport. Staff friendly and generally efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs to be updated”
Reviews.Author: travelme79
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel but the rooms need to be updated..I am honors member and the free breakfast is pretty bad but its free.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Friendly Staff & Wonderful Beds”
Reviews.Author: JanaLB
Reviews.Content: We were given a voucher from Westjet to stay here as our flight was delayed in Puerto Plata which caused us to miss our connection in Toronto. We checked in at 11:30 pm last night. The staff was the best ever. Starting with a pleasant check-in, to fabulous service when orderring food @ bar to bring to our room, (since we had not eaten all day) right down to the bell-man handing my family warm cookies while they were waiting for all this to finish. My children feel asleep as soon as their heads hit the pillows and they told me in the morning it was because the beds were so comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Possible bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Wellsieiscool
Reviews.Content: Thurs. Jan. 12, 2012 my husband and I were given coupons to stay at the airport doubletree by air canada after a flight cancellation. 8 days later he started showing several dozen bed bug type bites (they can show up shortly after to 2 weeks after the bite). I started scratching a couple days after. We are now quite covered in the bites. We stayed on what I think was an unrenovated floor in the hotel that... left a lot of be desired in terms of decor, modernity, odour etc. but we were there for one night, so what the heck. Anyway, there's no real way to say for sure, but I would be pretty surprised if it was something else.

Reviews.Title: “the cookie!!!”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanCanadaQueen
Reviews.Content: its that warm cookie when you check in that keeps us coming back....or is it the amazing staff.....its everything. hey to manny at the bar your the best!!!! the staff are amazing.....awesome location...the beds are to die for. we come here for the park and fly a couple times a year. the best place to stay....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: coco_ty
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night for a conference and it couldn't have been better. The staff are very friendly and always willing to help. Great choice of restaurants. Room was spacious and bed comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “handled it pretty well, considering”
Reviews.Author: Labwonder
Reviews.Content: Nov.30, 2011 we were to stay at the Doubletree, prior to flying out the following morning. Upon arrival at the hotel, we discovered that the hotel had just had a major water "leak" and power outage. But, I thought the staff handled the entire affair quite well and in short time they were arranging to have people moved to another hotel, as the staff was unsure of when we would be able to check in at the Doubletree. Doubletree arranged/ensured that the other hotel honoured all parking, room requests, etc. and it all worked out quite nicely for us. I was impressed. Thanks Doubletree. We will give you another opportunity another time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ETBrown
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Doubletree was great. As the end point of my trip to India, I was able to conveniently park my car, take the shuttle to Pearson. A great breakfast and friendly staff on my return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beachcomber626
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Doubletree the night before flying out on vacation, every time. It is a clean, attractive hotel with very comfortable beds. The Orchid Cafe is a great place to eat..we have ordered from the menu and tried the buffet, also. The food and service are great. We love the cookies that they give you when checking in...what a treat. No need to stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good facilities”
Reviews.Author: YEGcg
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here unexpectedly, as a result of a flight delay (room paid by Air Canada). At check in, the front desk clerk repeatedly suggested a room with 2 beds, although we only needed one. We took the room with 2 beds - I have to say, it's nice to have a comfy hotel bed to yourself once in a while! Also at check in, there was a young family that had a lot of luggage who were checking in at the same time. It would have been nice to see a staff member offer assistance (a staff member gave them a luggage cart - on condition that they bring it back right away). The beds were good, the Internet fast, and the room/bathroom were clean. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable hotel, fantastic food!!!:)”
Reviews.Author: steph86727
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying here because my flight was cancelled, therefore west jet put us up in this hotel. Very clean hotel, the beds were so comfortable and the pillows were amazing! Food at the orchid cafe was amazing, we had the buffett lunch which included, sauteed red potatoes, lasagna, rice, steamed vegies, salad bar, stuffed chicken breast with cranberries, fruit and cheese, and lots of dessert to choose from; decent price 17.95. We hyad west jet vouchers to use so it only ended up costing us 6 bucks lol Great location for the hotel close to the airport:) Only downfall we had was we had to check out of our room at 12:00 noon, and wait around all day for our flight,they should allow customers to keep their room until at least 3:00 pm, but oh well it was only for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stopover Rates”
Reviews.Author: Milandralove
Reviews.Content: We stay at airport hotels prior to all vacations for the ease of transport to the airport before our flight. We have tried a couple of other hotels on the strip and always end up coming back to the Double Tree. They have great stopver rates where you can leave your vehicle at the hotel for the duration of your flight. They have shuttles to and from the airport. The rooms are nice, clean and up to date. Check in is always quick and they always give you warm chocolate chip cookies during check in. We will definately be returning to the Double Tree prior to our next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: gereme
Reviews.Content: Time spent at the Double-tree Hilton hotel in Toronto, Ontario, Canada was truly a home away from home experience for me. I enjoyed spending three nights on one of the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Room service was simply the best hospitality ever imagined, and the staff treated their guests as if we were their royal family. Included in my room was a computer and high speed internet which worked like a charm considering that a TV and good old fashion cable was all that I expected to find when I got there. Overall I think that this hotel is one of the best that I have ever stayed at and I would like to rate it with (5) stars.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nearnorthduo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights and found the accomodations to be very good. The executive room was comfortable and well appointed and clean. I am a stickler for clean! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good sleep, free airport shuttle. Dated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: archangeli
Reviews.Content: 2.5 stars: check-in process was rushed (but I did stay here on one of their busiest weekends of the year and it was 100% fully booked) and I almost didn't get a parking pass. Got my Doubletree cookie though! The staff were polite and courteous though. I was told they had no fridges available, when I has specifically requested one in the room when I booked. The beds were comfortable and there was a nice flat screen LG tv (which incidentally I never turned on all weekend) but the rooms are definitely dated. There are 4 pillows on each double bed, with 2 extra in the closet but no extra duvets. Fold-up cots are available from the front desk on request (subject to availability, and possibly a fee?). The overall decor of the room is dated and starting to look a bit worn, especially if you look at the ceiling. There is industrial fluorescent lighting in the bathroom (not ideal). Also, the placement of the shower head is ridiculous! It was aimed below the nape of my neck (and I'm 5'8") - so it was installed with someone 4'5" tall in mind?! One of my friends who is 6'2" had to squat in the bathtub to wash his hair. However, the Crabtree & Evelyn amenities were nice. Our bathroom had drainage problems in sink & toilet. When we got around to phoning the front desk about it at 11:30pm we were told someone would come right up... by 1am no one had shown up (and my roommate and I wanted to go to sleep!) so we phoned the front desk again. We were informed that there was no maintenance staff on duty at this hour, that they could send someone up with a plunger but we would have to take care of it ourselves!! There is a very sensitive thermostat- it got either too hot or too cold quickly but was impossible to get the temperature to stay at something comfortable. There is complimentary wifi, but it was not working both nights I stayed. The pool (and waterslide) are accessed through the main lobby and anyone walking by can see you in there. My friends went in for a dip at 5-6am and the hot tub was COLD. The Grand Chinese Cuisine restaurant is excellent (but a bit pricey). There is a hotel shuttle to Pearson International Airport, and a bus stop right outside the hotel where the TTC and GO buses stop. It is also located directly in front of the Toronto Congress Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but dated”
Reviews.Author: Jay G
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel in the past and gave it another try. Next time I will stay at the Hilton down the street! The hotel is getting dated. While it is clean and the staff are great it is time for the hotel to get a major facelift.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: craigger
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night as a stopover package. We had parking for up to 2 weeks. Staff were friendly, rooms clean, enjoyed the planes going by. Not loud for an airport hotel. Overall a nice hotel and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable 3-Day Business Trip...”
Reviews.Author: sillysavage
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Doubletree for 3 days in March for a work-related convention. The convention centre was directly across the street from the hotel, so the location was ideal.Upon arrival we were treated to warm chocolate chip cookies at the front desk. There was a problem with our initial room (we were given 2 Queens, instead of the King we requested), which was quickly sorted out. We did have noisy neighbours across the hall that kept us up past 1 am, but the front desk was efficient and dealt with it quickly. We ate one meal in the hotel, there are many restaurants in this huge facility so I cannot fairly say the quality of the food served at all of them, but the one meal I ate in the bar the first night we were there left me with stomach cramps that lasted 2 days...so maybe skip that one? Otherwise, the stay was a perfect fit for our needs, the staff was friendly, the room clean and vast, and our cleaning lady was awesome & friendly.

Reviews.Title: “I will return!”
Reviews.Author: CanadaVirgi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Doubletree because we were flying out at 6:00 a.m., the following morning. Checking in was quick and easy, and of course included the famous warm chocolate chip cookie.The room was clean and spacious and had all the amenities. We ordered room service, it took awhile to actually connect with them, but once we did the food arrived quickly and still hot. The wake up call was on time, the shuttle to the airport was free, and our car stayed in their closed in parking lot for 2 weeks for the price of the room. All in all it was a great experience and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Tiggersue2u
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for one night but the hotel was clean and service was friendly. The room was nice but nothing over the top. The bathroom could use some updating but for a business trip it was more than needed.

Reviews.Title: “Very good airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kballtex
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night. Non smoking room but reeked of smoke. Other than this it was pretty decent. Be advised that parking is pretty pricey.

Reviews.Title: “If your a family you might want to pass on this hotel”
Reviews.Author: warwiac
Reviews.Content: Stayed there on a Saturday night. Met family members there to take advantage of the pool and a low room rate (89). Parking is an additional $12, and seems very convoluted with vouchers required everytime you leave the parking area. Free internet. The pool is nice for families, with 2 slides (if there open, check that first before you stay) However the pool is located probably 500 yards away from the elevators, so it's quite a journey to get there. Hotel isn't particularly family friendly, obviously more geared to conferences and 1 night in and out airport travellers. One thing I particularly didn't like is the complete lack of luggage carts, there may have been a 1/2 dozen for the entire hotel which are kept locked up. Obviously this is a ploy to generate revenue for the bell staff, making it very difficult to get one for yourself. Hotel is directly on the take off flight path for the airport, so expect a thurndering takeoff every 2-3 minutes. The room was small but in good shape and clean. All in all, if your going to take the family as a getaway or for the pool, you can find alot better than this. Wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel... Good location for Stay, Park, and Fly...”
Reviews.Author: CuteTravellers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (plus three other couples) stayed at this hotel prior to flying out to Cuba. We checked in, had some dinner, and spent the night - then caught the shuttle to the airport. All was good, except it would be nice if the airport shuttle did not shut down between 2 & 4 a.m. as that is when we have to go to the airport, so you either have to go really early, or risk being late. Otherwise all was fine and we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for Quick Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Rav22
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel since I was tired of the Courtyard on Carlingview where I always seem to stay. Also, this hotel was close to where my work was. It was cool to see the planes fly over the building right before landing. It appears that the hotel was soundproofed very well, since the noise from the planes was minimal. The front desk staff was very helpful at check -in. The price for parking (C$12.00) was reasonable, compared to other hotels in the area. There were two minor issues that I had with the hotel: 1. It was difficult to park nearby when checking in. There were no signs to show where check-in was, and the parking to check-in could be better. I found a place near the taxi stand, but it wasn't the right location. If you're driving, the other location in front of the hotel is awkward since you will need to go around the block to park in the lot. 2. I asked not to receive a newspaper, which I didn't. However, it was not deducted from the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds, but a/c issues..”
Reviews.Author: MikeGB2
Reviews.Content: I stay at the hotel for 5 nights twice a year, due to a convention in the hotel, so I have come to know it well. At last the elevator upgrade has been completed this year so they are MUCH better than last year, so at least no line ups. My big problem this time was the A/C in my room. You can't turn off the fans in the rooms which are noisy at best, so I generally set the temp to ambient so hopefully it doesn't keep blowing through the night, as it definitely disturbs sleep. This time, nothing I did made the a/c keep quiet and it was a big problem. My final night, for some reason the a/c was blowing ice cold air all night and it was freezing in my room. I like a cold room but that was like a fridge. I spent most of the night awake as it was so cold, and on complaining in the morning I was offered a breakfast, which to be honest I never eat there as the buffet is not great. The girl asked what she could do for me and did eventually credit the night when I suggested it. I thought it should have been offered a bit sooner but I did leave happier, albeit very tired due to lack of sleep. This was on the exec floor as well so I was disappointed. I have never found the air traffic a problem at all, and have always found the rooms to be quiet, except for the a/c! All in all, a very nice hotel, comfortable, good staff, although as I mentioned, the breakfast buffet is expensive and not very good value, although the choices are reasonable. I use the Tim Horton's across the road as a rule. The bar staff is great, and it is also nice to see that the bar menu has changed at last. Not before time. I really do think that the hotel all around needs a bit of an update, especially the a/c's in the rooms! The Japanese restaurant is very nice but expensive although not owned by the hotel. I use the sushi restaurant half a block away. It's really great. LOVE the cookies at check in! Try the room service chocolate chip ice cream sandwich....fabulous!!...but only eat 1 if you as the calories will kill you!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel too busy for customers?”
Reviews.Author: Arxxra
Reviews.Content: 5 friends and I were going to a convention at Toronto Congress Centre. We arrived at the hotel after a 6h trip with 2 rooms booked at least 4-5 months earlier. It said that we could get our rooms starting 15h00 but even at 17h30 the rooms were still not ready and we had lots of packages, including food, that we couldn't leave in the car. The first staff member we saw at 15h00 admitted that the hotel was overbooked, and that if we had arrived a little later, we might have ended up with no rooms at all. After 2h30 we were scared to loose our food ( our cooler needed to be plugged in the wall) so we went back and after a lot of talking, we got two rooms, different from the ones we reserved in the first place and not on the same floor but at least we could plug our cooler. When we booked the room, we asked the hotel to reserve a fridge for us in one of the room, no fridge were available when we arrived. We met with a guy who was part of the "overbooked" people, and he had to carry his luggage all day long for 2 days, with no sleeping place since no other hotel was available either. He stated that he was sleeping in the fast food around the corner... - Forget room service if you're not ordering food. - Mastresses are very comfortable and is the only thing I really enjoyed. Perfect bed according to us. - The room was clean and big enough for us. It is the type of hotel you don't stay in all day, you go out for activities. - The room is overprice for what it offers. We had better service and room in other Toronto hotels the previous years. I know that during the convention, hotel staff are busy since the hotel participates to the activities, but I believe they could have planned more staff and not overbook (so that people don't sleep in the streets!)

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: marielco
Reviews.Content: I had read some very negative reviews of this hotel before attending a four day conference there in June. I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived to find it far more pleasant than these reviews had led me to expect. My room was clean and well appointed. The free Wi Fi worked perfectly. I found the staff to be courteous and efficient. As I was attending a conference I did not get to use the leisure facilities. The food provided for the conference was very good. I did find the breakfast buffet a little dissapointing. I used the business center to prepare and print some documents with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: familytravelx3
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice. It was clean, comfortable, modern, but not very large. The pool and water slides are great for children. Must be 48" to use the water slides, and they're only open when lifeguards are present. Our room was not cleaned very well during our stay but was very clean upon arrival. On-site restaurants are pricey for family dinners. There is plenty of parking for a fee. There are very large power line towers in the parking lot. And of course many airplanes passing closely by. Staff was child-friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hotel room...Top notch Service!”
Reviews.Author: JaneDoe99
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel for a Stopover rate with parking included for 14 days , and by far it was the best deal this close to the airport. The hotel room was large but dated...it really needs a refurbishing. The hallways outside need the carpet replaced or extensively cleaned...it was beyond stained! But as I said the room was big because we had a corner room with a king bed and a pull out sofabed.We also had a great view watching planes take off and land at the airport, which was a thrill for my small daughter. BUT...due to the great plane watching it was EXTREMELY noisy at night when you are trying to sleep. The roar of jet engines kept me awake until around midnight I guess..that is when most late flights end. The swinmming pool was large but the water slides were only open from 4 to 7 pm, when a lifeguard would be on duty. My little one was very dissapointed. As was I , due to the fact I was not aware of this when I looked online. Maybe I missed it posted there , but if I had known I would have arranged my arrival time and pool time a little differently. But now the really good! When we had left the hotel to go to the airport we realized that our daughter had misplaced the beloved stuffed toy she was carrying. I told her we would check back with them when we landed after our trip but to not be too disappointed if they couldn't find him. When we arrived back at the hotel and asked at the front desk, both men working smiled and one pulled the stuffed toy from the lost and found bin and returned it to a very happy girl! Not only did they both seem happy that they made a little girl happy, they then asked if she would like a cookie (they give warm ones at check-In). Wow...she didn't think her day could get any better, and neither could I . It was so appreciated , and they were so friendly. Cudos to them :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great for Kids, Pet Friendly”
Reviews.Author: JeniferTravels
Reviews.Content: We really liked staying at this hotel for several reasons: *great indoor pool for the kids *convenient location to the airport, close to the main roads that go to downtown Toronto *pet friendly *excellent price for close to $100/night This hotel was big and spacious. Every employee we encountered was professional and offered impeccable customer service. The food offered via room service is good and there is a spa if you need to relax and unwind. There is also a secured parking area, which made us feel comfortable. Overall this is a great hotel and we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff but hotel (not the logo) needs a makeover”
Reviews.Author: Finke
Reviews.Content: Stranded here b/c missed connection and arrived as a family of 5 at 11:00 pm. Front desk staff was very helpful, friendly, and listened carefully to our concerns to find the room arrangement that would work for us. Got connecting rooms (each kind and pull our sofa), which were very spacious. While everything worked, both rooms need a makeover of everything - most importantly carpet and paint. They have such a 1980th kind a feel... Both rooms were clean, but the elevator areas and the hallways were not. The breakfast was ok for a doubletree and, again, the staff was very friendly. The hotel has pool with two water slides, which would potentially be a lot of fun for the kids if we would have been there between 4 and 8 pm; looking at the "water slide closed" signs, however, is a bummer... One final sidebar: the lobby had a large display about the fact that Doubletree had change their logo: who had that crazy idea? The old logo is one of the few hotel logos that are really great and you change it to D and something else?

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: momof6kidsinMN
Reviews.Content: I ended up at this hotel quite unexpectedly after missing my connecting flight on the way back from my vacation. AirCanada gave me a voucher to stay at the DoubleTree as well as a meal voucher. I was a little hesitant but was really pleasantly surprised! The front desk staff was great, for a few extra bucks I upgraded my room a bit (needed more work space), and everything was very clean and nice (the bed was very comfortable!). I had also received a voucher for dinner at Harry's (right in the hotel) and the food was really quite good. Harry's was swamped due to all the folks with missed connections trying to eat at the same time, but the staff took it all in good spirits. In short, I would definitely consider this to be a viable option as far as hotels go in Toronto near the airport. However, there is one major and one minor factor that might prevent me from doing so. Major: needing to take the airport shuttle between the hotel and airport. The shuttle was full in the morning and some people had to wait for the next shuttle - this could cause an issue if you hadn't planned in advance for such a thing to happen. Minor: the airplanes were quite noisy even in the room - perhaps the window glass could be more soundproof? Tip*: Ask how far your room is from the elevator - some rooms are REALLY far away and a huge pain to walk to miles of hallways will alot of luggage. Tip*: The Blue Martini is excellent

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Guest but were highly disappointed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Valibro
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year around the same time because the price was reasonable compared to what the hotels in downtown Toronto charged. Our stay last year was GREAT thats why we decided to stay here again even though its about 20 mins away from downtown. We checked in early and being a silver HHonors member we were given our room at 9 am which was excellent, however we were travelling with 2 young kids 4 and 5 and requested to have a refrigerator, extra pillows, water, juice delivered to the room...they NEVER came. Upon opening our door the room reeked of vomit and the rug was wet as though they tried to shampoo the scent out....we also had to walk through like 3 corridors just to get to the elevator...the pool was a hit with the kids being that it has a water slide also.....there's multiple restaurants and stores on site which is a plus but then we found out that we had to pay for parking which was 12.00 a day....We decided to check out the next day since we couldnt be moved to another room and the items we requested were never delivered...for repeat guest, we were truly disappointed especially being that Hilton goes above and beyond for its guest....I guest the Ritz Carlton no longer has competition!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a night's stay before/after flight”
Reviews.Author: nadma
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel one night for connection flight. I have no complaints. The hotel has nice pool, nice terrace, nice buffet, nice lobby, nice coffe shop, nice rooms. Everything was very clean. The shuttle to/from airport was painless and on time. Service was very professional. Beds were comfortable. Bathroom a bit dated but I didn't care because it was functional and I was not staying for a long time. Nice touch to have strawberries dipped in chocolate and other sweet goodies. I will definetely stay there again for an overnight connection flight. I highly recommend for that purpose. Note that I got a decent price thru priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Room”
Reviews.Author: sacbe
Reviews.Content: We have stayed many times at this hotel, but this was the worst. Wanted to take a bath, but when I ran the water it was brown. Called front desk for extra coffee, NO-ONE ever came, the air-conditioning was so loud, the fan was soooo dirty. Let the front desk know about these problems, but they could care less..maybe it is time to look for a new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Checked in 5 hours late with little accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: EKroeker_11
Reviews.Content: My friend and I bought a certificate for a weekend away at a silent auction. We arrived at 4:30 planning to swim and get ready for a nice evening on the town. When we got there we were told that the hotel was booked to capacity and that they could check us into a smoking room right away but would have to wait 45 min until a non-smoking room was available. Being allergic to smoke we opted to wait in the bar until we were called. An hour and a half later we still had not been called. We went to the front desk to see if our room was ready and it was not. We were not told an estimated time so we asked what they could do for us since we were planning on going out for dinner. We were told they would pay for our parking pass. After some arguing, we did get them to agree to pay for our drinks at the bar and an appetizer. By the time we did get to our room it was 8'oclock. We were hungry, discruntled, and disappointed. We were not happy with the service we received, they didn't even seem apologetic that we waited 3 and a half hours to be checked in. When check-in is 3:00 we should not have had to wait until 8:00 that evening for an available room.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: ctmo
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable 3 night stay here. The rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. The kids loved the pool, the only thing is I wish I had known of the height restriction of the pool slide when I asked if they had a pool upon registering. I had one disappointed little girl over this. She wasn't even allowed to go down the slide with a parent.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: naveenyalla
Reviews.Content: Considering it to be catering mainly to airport customers it is a good place. Service is ok. Check in was prompt, rooms were neat and clean. Room service good. cooked up a nice meal I had ordered late at night. Buffet was ok. I don't think hotels put too much thought in planning a buffet. The hotel has a swimming pool, a spa and multi cuisine restaurants. Good for a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely spacious room”
Reviews.Author: MaiseyDaisey
Reviews.Content: We booked this room the night before staying from our previous accommodation and so we didn't spend much time researching it. We had considered staying centrally in Toronto, but although the room rates were only a little more, the cost of parking (some quoting $23/Â£15 a night plus the obligatory taxes!) would have raised the cost of the stay to silly amounts of money for what you actually got. The hotel is on the main run into the airport and you can find several places to eat nearby - Tim Horton's, Swiss Charlet, Kelsey's, Perkins and one we wished we had found - Tucker's Marketplace on the road nearer the airport from the hotel. Check-in was effecient and polite and came with a warm cookie for each traveller. The room was on the top floor and was spacious with two large double beds, excellent TV and a lovely full length window - big enough for my husband and our older teenager son to spread our cases in! We were at the back side and had a view of the city in the distance (beautiful in the hazy sunshine) and the airport runway - which we also enjoyed watching the planes take off above us! May be some would find that ugly and noisey, but not us. Room came with slippers, dressing gowns, good coffee and water - all nice little perks and made up for lack of breakfast in rate. Clean, bright and modern - comfortable bed gave us a really good night's sleep. Check-out was noon, which enabled us to have a lie in before our night flight home. On site parking here was CAD$12/Â£8 +tax. Room cost CAD$135/Â£88, which considering we had paid $113/Â£74 for a very grotty Quality Inn in Orillia, we thought was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, no interest in good service”
Reviews.Author: NashTNtraveler
Reviews.Content: We had to stay here due to a missed flight. The shuttle bus driver was pleasant, but the bus itself had no shock absorbers. Staff at the desk wasn't paying enough attention even to be described as being rude, zero warmth, answered basic questions like "where's the restaurant?" and "what time do the shuttles run in the morning?" with quick mutters. The hotel was virtually empty, but they put us at the far end of a long hallway rather than near the elevator. The room stank, a stale fried food and dirty clothes smell. One small window could be partially opened. All in all a bad experience, a bad introduction to Toronto. I'm assuming their business model depends on stranded passengers.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked, bad staff and customer service”
Reviews.Author: dncarolyn_73
Reviews.Content: Showed up at check-in time and found out the hotel was overbooked. We came back at the time they suggested (two hours later) and the room still wasn't ready. By that time we had other commitments, so we couldn't check in until midnight. Staff were rude and generally unhelpful. I emailed Doubletree by Hilton after the stay and received no response. Terrible customer service! It felt like my staying there was an inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Staff makes this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tweets64
Reviews.Content: Very accommodating. Mix up with the room but was fixed in a matter of minutes. Front staff awesome. Friendly. Kids loved the pool. Great restaurants on site. Rooms are clean. Older Hotel but good value for where you are. Very large Hotel. If you have small kids ask to stay closer to the elevator. Very long walk to some rooms, but again it is a BIG Hotel Definitely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: DFK100
Reviews.Content: This was the first time my wife and I stayed at this hotel we were there for a meeting from the time we checked in to the time we left we were very happy the room was clean and the bed was great i can not wait till our group meets there again in December

Reviews.Title: “Decent prices, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: StarfallDarling
Reviews.Content: I stay here annually for a convention, and I have to say, the hotel is looking prettier this year, with its recent elevator upgrades! Housekeeping staff, as always, is amazingly sweet. Front desk staff could maybe take a few deep breaths and calm down. I found that they were a little bit short with me upon checking in, and while I realize that conventions create a large volume of people, there isn't any need to have that affect the way you interact with your guests. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfy, and above all, the location was excellent! It's worth noting, if you haven't clued in by the name, this is an AIRPORT hotel! That means you'll get planes flying over. I'm a heavy sleeper, so this didn't bother me. But light sleepers, I would encourage you to bring your ear plugs! Also, check out the Orchid Cafe. Great prices, and good food!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: miamibeach99
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Comfortable, and clean. Staff was efficient and friendly. The hotel was a great value overall.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Service”
Reviews.Author: AmyLaurent
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights here in May and the location was perfect for me. Very close to the airport with a free shuttle both ways. I hadnâ€™t stayed at a doubletree before so I donâ€™t have a point of comparison but I had a wonderful stay. There was something very â€˜nostalgicâ€™ about the hotel. Itâ€™s a large hotel with a number of restaurants and services. I only ate at the CafÃ© and the Japanese restaurant but my colleagues mentioned the Italian restaurant was quite good as well. When I arrived I was given a cookie that had just been baked and check-in was easy. The room itself needed updating but was clean and comfortable. On the bed was a pillow which said â€˜Sweet Dreamsâ€™ and thatâ€™s just what youâ€™ll have! One of the best sleeps Iâ€™ve had in a hotel. One of the best things about this place was the desk clerk named Carl. I had a number of issues (none of which were the hotelâ€™s fault) and he helped me with everything. I had forgotten my medication back home and Carl contacted my pharmacy and had them fax over my prescription to a Canadian pharmacy. He then arranged for a 4 day prescription to be filled and to have it delivered to the hotel! My luggage had also been lost by Delta (DELTA â€“ â€œDonâ€™t Expect Luggage To Arriveâ€�â€¦. A funny joke he shared with me). Since I was told my luggage would not arrive I was stressed about my clothing for the next day. He told me where I could get inexpensive temporary clothing and offered to set up a rental car. Iâ€™ve never received this kind of service at a hotel or otherwise. He was more like a genuine friend rather than a clerk. After all of this you can imagine I needed a drink and they have a great place called â€˜Harryâ€™s Barâ€™. Phil the bartender took great care of me and even gave me a double on the house. I think he saw the sorrow in my eyes! All in all, a great stay. I would say your money would be well spent just for the service standards of the hotel. Iâ€™m curious to explore more Doubletree hotels now to see if they all have this feel to them. Hope this was helpful, enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Meetings”
Reviews.Author: nickyvenables
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after many years traveling to other hotels in the Toronto Area. This hotel has a huge amount of meeting space and worked really well for us since we needed a few different size rooms. The bedrooms are comfortable, maybe needs a little updating, but very clean. The executive lounge was a nice perk since it was a bit quieter than being in the restaurant. Overall a very good and clean hotel. The staff were very nice and helpful when asked. Would choose this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome place for a bridge tournament”
Reviews.Author: gandalf974
Reviews.Content: Everything was excellent and the housekeeper for our room was outstanding (Aleksandra).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: BBora
Reviews.Content: Excellent value close to airport. All possible amenities at a very reasonable price. Professional staff, well managed. Pet friendly, will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming, friendly, clean and comfortable experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer05031961
Reviews.Content: Great value! Staff are very friendly and ensure that you are satified with your room. Kids love the pool after a long drive to the hotel on a Friday night. Safe and easy to leave the car behind and the shuttle service is on time at both ends of your travels. Staff are very helpful. Several staff went out of their way to assist mom and her kids when they returned from trip to discover a flat tire. We did not have CAA at the time, and the staff worked on a Sunday morning until the tire was fixed and we were on our way home. They made us feel welcome as we waited, and were extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Room fills the need”
Reviews.Author: Vickie_Bernie
Reviews.Content: I stay here a lot. They seem to always spell my name wrong and I spend more time trying to prove my reservation. Check in is smooth love the cookie. Rooms are in need of some TLC as per my photos. And I was on the executive floor! Shuttle service is always excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not Sure How This Hotel is in the Hilton Brand”
Reviews.Author: Mike_the_Traveler74
Reviews.Content: I travel often for business and I remain fairly loyal to the Hilton Honors program as I can get my points at many brands offered by Hilton. Generally speaking, every time I book a hotel under the Hilton Brand I know exactly what I'm getting.......not the case this time around. Now I like to consider myself fairly open minded, patient and down to earth but my stay here was awful. I started staying at Doubletrees wherever possible because they are hotels which usually have an upscale but comfortable environment (sometimes the full service Hilton's are a bit too sterile for me). There was absolutely nothing upscale or comfortable about this hotel. I arrived at the Toronto airport and I was picked up by the Hotel shuttle. The shuttle was on time, exactly where it said it would be and even though I didn't need it I was offered luggage assistance.......a great start! Upon arriving at the hotel I was incredibly disappointed. It was late afternoon and the first thing I saw while stepping off of the truck were the lobby windows, completely filthy.....hand prints, dust, dirt, everything you could think of. I'm not speaking of some build up in between cleanings, I'm speaking of windows which clearly hadn't been cleaned in months. As I entered the doors the first thing I saw to my left was a large powerbar/powercord with plugs in it for the lobby lamps...... also from the 80s or earlier? Awful brass lamps. Of course after these two things I noticed everything, dirty pink and green carpet everywhere and a truly eerie feeling.......absolutely nothing upscale at all. Keeping in mind this is all my first impression. I approached the desk, still with an open mind, and things got even worse. There was a dedicated line for Hilton Honors members so I made my way there. A really rude woman said 'You didn't see me waiting for you over there?' while pointing to a terminal a bit of the way down. She was full of attitude, rolled her eyes, didn't smile even once and even worse, focused mostly on her computer. As each hotel is different, usually the desk agent tells me my benefits as a Hilton member....I was told nothing at all except my membership was on file. I took my key, regretting being booked into the hotel, and made my way up to the executive floor (the 12th floor) to get to my room. I'm not sure how this was the 'executive' floor as it was musty, dirty, with old carpeting and hallways that resembled something out of a horror film. I opened the door to my room and for a BRIEF moment I was mildly calm. I thought 'ok this isn't so bad'......wrong again. Other than a flat screen television (with no option to order movies??????????) the room was terribly out-dated. Once again, dirty carpet, destroyed furniture, and old fixtures. My bathroom had peeling wallpaper, a dirty mirror and mold all over the grout.........and this is all to the naked eye! I called downstairs and told the front desk I was unhappy with my room and they told me 'Well sir, if you aren't happy on the executive floor that's our best'. I was exhausted from a long day at work without the energy to argue.....and with such disgust I simply let it go and quickly opened my laptop and booked the Hilton Garden Inn Toronto Airport (review to follow). I ordered something to eat because I truly thought, how can a burger and fries go wrong? WELL..............LET ME TELL YOU............Great burger! Perfect fries, well done just like I asked for....... and promptly delivered. When it comes to hotels it doesn't take much to keep me happy. All I need is a clean comfortable room and I don't even ask for the staff to be OVERLY friendly.......simply alert and helpful. This was hands down the worst Doubletree experience I've ever had and I will never........ever.......return to this hotel. On the plus side.....(yes there are a few)....... It's close to the airport. The food was great, the cookie I received when I arrived was exactly the same as every other Doubletree cookie I've had (perfect). The porter was funny and helpful and you could tell he would do anything for you. All in all.......I just don't think a good burger and a porter who smiles is what a hotel is all about.......

Reviews.Title: “Fast & neat.”
Reviews.Author: MikeP12
Reviews.Content: Check in & check out were fast , guest services were always at the ready it seemed . housekeeping was fast & cheerful .

Reviews.Title: “A noisy 4 nights...”
Reviews.Author: jfsabs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree for 4 nights. I was attending a conference at the hotel so I figured it would be easy to stay at the hotel and not have to drive the 401 in traffic each morning. I got there the first night, and had a really rude bellboy take my luggage. The front desk gave me directions to the parking garage...and ended up telling me to go to the exit of the lot. I had to drive back and around and finally got parked (for $12/night). The bellboy proceeded to take my bags on the luggage cart, and was banging the cart around corners and hitting the houskeeping cart. Not appreciated! I got to my room on the 9th floor and it smelled smoky (even though I was on a nonsmoking floor). I called down to the lobby and switched rooms. The room itself was nice but sort of outdated. Nice big flatscreen tv, 2 queen beds and a nice view of the toronto congress centre (so bright at night). I went in the bathroom and found several long black hairs on the floor which I was very grossed out by (considering I have blonde hair so I know its not mine!). The concierge (Anthony I think) was very nice and helped me find a clip to close my curtains as there was a spot of light that kept shining in. Also gave me an extra cookie :) The planes are SO noisy and same with the traffic on Dixon road. I had a really tough time falling asleep...and as soon as I did, the planes would start again at 6:30 AM. You would think that a hotel by the airport would be a bit more soundproof. There is a nice fitness centre and a swimming pool. As I was going up the stairs to the slide, the steps were really grimey and dirty. I was regretting not wearing shoes on the steps! There are several restaurants in the hotel....also a bunch across the street (Tims, subway, milestones, kelseys) which was nice. There is free internet in your room (sometimes it was fast, sometimes it was slow). All in all, I would not stay here again unless I had to. I will take the 401 traffic and a quiet nights sleep over the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Is Always A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: NortherngirlCanada
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Doubletree often for business. It is near the airport and far from downtown Toronto. I have never had a problem with check in. It is very standard and quite quick. They give you a warm chocolate chip cookie when you check in which is always a nice treat after a long flight. The hotel has several options for restaurants. The Orchid Cafe has a buffet and a sit down menu. There is also a small bar attached. The food is typical and hits the spot. Alfredo's is more upscale and has excellent Italian cuisine. Ginko is an excellent Japenese restaurant with entertaining show cooking. Grand Chinese is a newer restaurant and has excellent food. In addition there is always room service. Rooms are clean and have comfortable beds and plump pillows. There are several different room choices so there is something for everyone. The hotel has a pool and whirlpool and 2 waterslides. There is also a fitness room and hairdresser. There is a great little shop called Swansea with lots of bling. You can buy purses and jewelery and woman's clothing that is a little different and you might not see elsewhere. Overall, I would recommend this hotel if you want to be near the airport. There is no shopping or entertainment nearby but many choices for restaurants. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree - Hotel ok, Concierge not”
Reviews.Author: TravellerforBusiness
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight on a Monday. Reception staff very slow but nice enough. HH free upgrade to large suite. Room was good, huge, a little outdated. Rotten pillows (for us) too padded. Too tired to ask for replace. Room had no fridge. Lots of spaces pre-built for bar fridge but all empty. Hotel amenity overload with large heated pool, 2 slides, hot spa, gym etc. Other guests in hot spa said they'd spent hours arranging for Technician to heat the hot spa. Very annoyed by Concierge guy (Kumar). Not sure whether he was Concierge or just a staff fellow standing in that area. Observed Kumar acting the fool over bell-hop carts. Many guests trying to unload cars and get out of loading zone in the dark during a snow-storm. No bell-hops. Kumar was loudly saying guests not allowed to self-load bell-hop carts. Err - and the other option was? Kumar provided us entirely false info re dining options. He advised the 3 onsite Restaurants and Room Service were all closed. We double-checked we'd understood him. He reconfirmed everything closed and said we'd need to take a cab to Toronto city for meals. Once settled in our room, we called Room Service. They were open. Lovely fast meal too. Not sure why Kumar thought everything was closed. Glad didn't taxi to Toronto... Note - if booked on an early flight (say before 7am) and plan to use Hotel Shuttle to airport, the shuttle was half-hourly and tardiness was not accepted. Worked for me! Yay! Latecomers - sit in the Foyer for half an hour whilst your shuttle races off without you - Don't be tardy for the party lol. Note - Customs/Immi/Check-In at Toronto to return to USA was nightmare - lengthy delays at 06:00. Perhaps time of the year was a factor. Nearly 2.5 hours required and many passengers missed flights. Got to be organised players :)

Reviews.Title: “Despite age, pretty well-run hotel”
Reviews.Author: irlundee
Reviews.Content: Aged hotel, very clean, a throwback with large main floor lots of eateries and a large pool with slides. Rooms spacious and clean. Only down points - due to age, fresh air system is non-existent so your room will get stuffy and smelly, forced air heating then dries skin and throat. Breakfast buffet fine for a three star, good selection but of course nothing freshly made for you. Location is near airport if you want more action this is the wrong spot. Staff friendly. Good deal at $80 or lower incl. Breakfast, fair deal if you pay $95 if you are paying $120 + the. You will be disappointed - as usual all relative to what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel for our Meetings”
Reviews.Author: balfour1976
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel as it was close to the airport for our recent regional meetings. The hotel has a huge convention space and it is located all under the same roof. The hotel room was very nice, clean and actually spacious. We were on the 8th floor and our room had a large flat panel televison on the wall that was a nice change than the old clunker of a tv you usually see. The staff were very friendly in the hallways and the check in was quick...which is exactly what I like. I didn't eat in the restaurant since we had food in our meeting room but there was tons of options. The meeting room was very nice and the decor seems to be recently updated. Overall this hotel was a wonderful surprise and we will definately use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location + Great Hotel = Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: belanger_mike99
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel as I was at a conference across the street. I simply choose because of location but I would definatly return next time I am in Toronto. The service was amazing and the bellman have a great attitude - always saying hello and really showing they care. The rooms met my needs and are not over the top. I had dinner in the Italian restaurant and I have to say it flavourful and delicious! There are tons of restaurants in and around the hotel - best of all there is a Tim Hortons across the street. This hotel was a pleasant surprise and I would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Close to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: Reggiebassman
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel the night before we flew to Jamaica (6am flight!!) and choose this hotel because it was close and the rate was the best we could find on Dixon. The hotel seems a bit older however you don't really notice. We were on the 7th floor and the room was actually spacious. Although I have stayed at other doubletrees which are typically newer, this hotel was great for us. The service was exceptional and we felt like we were at a 5 star hotel. There is tons of restaurants but we opted for just room service which was excellent and finally a hotel that severs hot food through room service. We will definitely stay here again.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel with all the amenities right on site!”
Reviews.Author: Didi_Corbeil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the DoubleTree for 2 nights while attending a conference recently held there. Our room was comfortable, clean and quiet. Plane noise was a minimum. As everyone states, the warm cookie was delightful. One thing we really appreciated was the lovely freshness of the air in our room. We slept comfortably on the plush beds and never heard a thing all night. The Sushi restaurant in the hotel is nice also. We made use of the Spa and found it to be a perfect ending to a long day. Thank you Jennifer at the Spa.!

Reviews.Title: “What else could go wrong??”
Reviews.Author: mdubeau
Reviews.Content: My first room 3260 (old section) was very hot, musty, stale air, stinky, windows did not open. Turned down heat, but never noticed a difference even after a few hours...could not stay in that heat and smell. My friends first room near mine, noticed a layer of the door was missing because it had got caught in the loose screw in the door frame. She tightened the loose screw with her finger. Then the entire locking mechanism on the door frame fell down, being held at best by the lower screw! You could see that the screws had been reattached several times over the years. Maintenance came to repair it with his pocket screwdriver (similar to a screwdriver you would use to repair glasses!) He did come back with a better screw driver. We requested and were given different rooms 4x11. Much better rooms, did not stink, were not grungy, and were cooler - although we had been told we could stay in the same room for our second night, we to change rooms. The third rooms 2260 &2248 were better than the first and second, but still not what one would expect given the name, the price ($189.99) and the lobby area. There were renovations happening on the elevator area on the second floor, with equipment all over the place. Please excuse the renovations! our joke was, they better hurry and get up to the third floor!! When my friend went to wash her hands in one of the conference washrooms, the entire faucet moved, it was not attached to the marble counter top! When I went to adjust the shower head, the entire plumbing in the wall moved! not surprising. We were there for a tools and technology conference, and the internet was so slow that the presenters could not do a efficient job- things would not download for them (apparently there were too many people using it for 'personal' use) In the evening in our rooms it was extremely slow as well (similar to dial up) . Check out time is 1pm, and the cleaning staff was in my room already when I went to get my belongings at 12pm. The cleaning lady was very nice and said she would leave while I gathered my stuff, but I had prepared everything I only had to pick them up... She did ask me to make sure my card worked in the door.. not sure if it was to be sure it was my room?? Our billing was a bit funky too, have to check my credit card when it comes in... One bill, the two rooms were on the same bill, the other had two separate bills... Unfortunately we did not have a camera with us, otherwise we certainly would have taken some pictures to share!!!

Reviews.Title: “Service Well Done”
Reviews.Author: voyager075
Reviews.Content: What stood out for me was the consistent friendly, prompt and professional service I received, both as a guest and as a presenter at a training workshop my client set up here. Banquet staff were superb, AV guy great, lobby folks helpful, airport van guy friendly. There are a lot of restaurants in the area, catering to a range of pocketbooks. My room was well appointed with a comfortable sitting area and good lighting at the desk and bed. And, miracle of miracles, despite the property being directly under one of Pearson Airport's flight paths, the place was quiet. Only problem was I couldn't get the room temperature down enough for a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room From Priceline.”
Reviews.Author: Billzilla66
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay overnight in Toronto, and I got this hotel room from Priceline for $65 a night. It's a nice room, even if the cleaning wasn't excellant (dust covered vents and crumbs near the windows). The beds were very cozy, and the hotel restaurant had a nice breakfast buffet (not free). I didn't get a chance to try out the pool or fitness centre, but the bar was nice and friendly. It's a bit of a distance from downtown Toronto (it takes about an hour by bus and subway), but it's still a nice hotel. I might go there again on my next excursion to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay - Unfriendly Staff - Drab and Worn Out, DIrty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MelodieH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Double Tree by Hilton during a business trip and was extremely disappointed with many aspects of this hotel. Rather than write a very long and drawn out review, I will provide a point form synopsis of the issues (which is long enough on its own): ~Colleague used his credit card to secure the rooms: they placed a 200% hold on the card for the rooms. This is NOT a standard practice. When asked about this, staff was not only unfriendly, but hostile, defensive and combative. Caused colleague's credit card to be declined after that. Oh, and the hold stayed on the card for several days AFTER successful payment! ~Housekeeping did not arrive until 5:30PM and when she did finally arrive, asked me to leave my room so she could clean it! The Housekeeping Manager arrived at some point and proceeded to yell at the cleaning lady in the hallway for being late - even going so far as to swear at her - loudly. Extremely unprofessional. ~Alarm going off in stairwell at midnight - not once, but TWICE during my stay. ~Heater broken in room - first night spent trying to sleep with A/C stuck on: I was freezing! ~Sink in room was cracked due to something smashing it. It was there so long, the crack was black: AKA: MOLD! ~Woke up in the middle of the night scratching - found a BUG IN MY BED (needless to say, I could not sleep that night, even after having torn my bed apart to ensure there were no others. Hardly able to stay awake during business the next day.) ~Bugs flying around the room the next day. Took pictures and showed front desk where I was accused of bringing into the room myself via luggage! When I stood up for myself, front desk staff backtracked and said he meant other guests. Nice deflection - not. Then tried to say they were fruit flies from food in my room. I did NOT have food in my room and he forgot I took a picture of the bugs. Showed to him again to prove they were some little flying beetle-type bugs. I finally got a new room and was told the old room was being fumigated. (Yeah, right - by housekeeping... at 11pm... ) ~Moved into new room (much smaller than what was paid for) on a floor that smelled of stale cigarette smoke (even though I explained I am terribly allergic to smoke). Had a nasty headache and felt ill for two days after that. ~Shampoo in new room was a half empty bottle!! Ewww... used toiletries displayed as if new! DISGUSTING! ~Mold in the shower ~Dust so thick on the sprinkler head near the ceiling that a CHUNK of it fell on me as I walked by. ~Restaurant extremely overpriced and very small breakfast buffet selection. The only nice thing about my stay at the Double Tree was the warm cookie presented on arrival. The server in the wine bar was very nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the cheap room price fool you”
Reviews.Author: ImLanman
Reviews.Content: Everything you have read in all of the reviews is accurate, with your enjoyment or disappointment of this hotel depending on your expecations. Expectiations met: Free shuttle from the airport (although I waited 40 minutes) Fast check-in (not friendly, but not rude desk staffing) Nicely equipped workout room and pool area Restaurant (Two Asian - open, One Italitan - closed) - I did not dine in one but heard positive reviews 1 LG LCD 32" TV in every room - which is adequate based on the tiny room size Expectations NOT met: The room is smaller than a tiny typical room you would get in Tokyo! The room smells like an old book store The bathroom is so tiny you can barely do your business - literally WiFi is free in your room, but not in the hotel lobby or bar, so don't plan on being social Adding to the above, don't plan on taking a drink to your room - yep... not allowed -so you can work in your room (without a beer), or you can have a beer but not work Drink prices are high and drink pours are low - a fitting accompanyment to the barstaff The hotel lobby is outdated with the general mood being subdued (at best) General: Plane sounds are about typical of any airport hotel Beds are colonial posts with now average mattresses In summary, the hotel is accurately priced (due to the obvious age of the property), but the cost adders quickly add up and become frustrating. I would suggest staying at another more modern property with better and larger rooms with most costs included in the initial room price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed. Hotel needs a major renovation.”
Reviews.Author: alice1203
Reviews.Content: I was shocked at the condition of this hotel, after booking it from Tripadvisor reviews and photos online from the hotels website. They have a very nice waterpark for kids (our daughter loved it), and the lobby is kind of nice, but it ends there. Three of five elevators aren't working, ("closed for modernization"), the hallways are dingy and yellow, so old and stale smelling that I was shocked walking down the hallway to our room. The room had updated beds, bedding, dressers and tv, but that's it. The room was old and so was the bathroom. We went to eat, and had a late evening snack in the lounge. The chairs are all stained and old, and the food was surprisingly poor. I was shocked that this could be a Hilton property. We have stayed in Doubletree's in the States and they have all been top notch. To tell you how much I didn't want to stay here again, on the way back from our trip (we overnighted for a caribbean holiday), I booked us into the Sheraton Conference Center and Hotel Airport location. I did this knowing that I had to give up my non-refundable room rate of $145, because we booked on hotels.ca. So I gave up that money and spent $175 to stay at the Sheraton. At the Sheraton, the hotel was lovely, the food was just superb and our room was great.

Reviews.Title: “Yikes - Believe the Bad Reviews”
Reviews.Author: jooksing
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times over the past few years. It is a tired old property. The good - Good restaurants, very good restaurants, free shuttle, good location near local convention center. The service was great The bad - My first room was awful. It smelled bad and had apparent water damage inside a wall and broken bathroom tile that was dangerous. Room vent was covered and choked with dust. It is a tired old property they should either retire or remodel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with everything you really need.”
Reviews.Author: packingandunpacking
Reviews.Content: As an airpot hotel, the Doubletree by Hilton likely has everything you need. Easy parking onsite for "park & fly", good restaurants onsite, a nice pool with waterslides and hot-tub for pre-trip relaxing, comfortable beds, soft pillows and an interesting ladies clothing and accessories shop for last minute trip needs. I stayed at this hotel for a conference and enjoyed all of the above features, but overall, this is a tired, old hotel. The room was a bit shabby. Walls, ceiling, trim and bathroom were showing wear. They were working on renovating the elevator interiors, so only three out of five elevators were working. This didn't cause a problem as there seemed to be very few guests, but on Sunday when we left, only one out of five elevators was working. Taking the stairs was not an option as we were checking out wiht luggage. The orchid restaurant serves a nice, standard breakfast buffet for $16. The lunch menu looked good. Directly across the street are Tim Horton's, Milestones, Harvey's, Kelsey's and the Toronto Congress Centre. If you are going to attend anything at the Congress Centre, this, or the nearby Radisson are the places to stay. Overall, a good hotel experience. Even with the airport just down the street, aircraft noise was minimal as the Doubletree is far enough away from Pearson that the planes are high in the sky by the time they are overhead.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: GILLANDERS41
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel as a stopover , going to Mexico for a week, with an early departure and parking on-site for the week. Everything was great, beds were heavenly, showers hot, nice lobby, front desk people were good, shuttle service ok, and on site parking perfect. Good price also. Sparkling clean also.

Reviews.Title: “Call for height restrictions on Water slide!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mom097
Reviews.Content: Staff was rude. Obviously only a stopover hotel, very confused repeatedly that we weren't flying out. Call for height restrictions on Water slide!!!!!!!!!! Bed was comfy, room was small and outdated. Planes woke us up all night.

Reviews.Title: “Lots to Love”
Reviews.Author: snorkelspaz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times for both business and pleasure most recently on Feb 8th. Check-in is usually very quick and the warm cookie is a nice touch. The room is very comfortable with a soft duvet and comfortable mattress. The towels in the bath are quite plush and I enjoy the Neutrogena bath products they provide, especially the face-wash which is a welcome change from regular soap. Alfredos in the lobby is an excellent Italian restaurant and I enjoy going there on pretty much every visit. The risotto is quite good and they serve rolls, crackers and a beautiful olive spread while you wait for your dinner. I have used the pool and hot tub although I find it a bit too far from the rooms and I donâ€™t like having to walk through the lobby to get there or back especially if I am wet. They have a wonderful little shop in the lobby that sells ladies accessories. I have purchased many interesting items there and always look forward to seeing what might be new. As a business travellor, it is nice to have a shop like that to stop in and browse. I enjoy the convienience of the airport shuttle and parking at the hotel. Going to the airport is always easy. Coming back not so much. The return shuttle is always a really long wait. It is frustrating to watch other hotels come by 2 or 3 times while you wait for the Doubletree shuttle. That is my one issue with this hotel, otherwise I like it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Cookies!”
Reviews.Author: Milandralove
Reviews.Content: We use the Double Tree by Hilton each year for our family vacation. They have a great stopover package that includes parking for up to 14 days. We book the basic room with two double beds as there are four of us (2 adults, 2 children). Check in has always been quick and they give you lovely warm chocolate chip cookies upon check in. The rooms are somewhat tight but they are clean and we only use it to sleep. The kids love the slide at the pool. The only drawback of the pool is that you have to walk through the lobby area and down a hallway past shops and conference rooms to get to the pool which can be ackward when you are in your bathing suits as a family and you are walking past shoppers and people attending conferences in suits. The last time we were there the lifeguard obviously had other things on her mind and didn't even face the pool. The slide is open only when the lifeguard is available which doesn't make sense a the lifeguard was in a room off to the side on her cell phone for most of the time we were down there. When she did come out she sat, wrapped up in towels at a table with her back to the pool. The pool itself is ok an there is a hot tub that is nice as well. The hotel also provides a shuttle to the airport and back to the hotel. For a stopover night it serves us well. We have never eaten at the restaurants so unfortunately I cannot comment on that. Overall I would give it a 3 1/2*

Reviews.Title: “A tired property with a new name”
Reviews.Author: Bookflyer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times several years ago when it was called simply the International Plaza Hotel. Other than the rebranding by Hilton to become a Doubletree, there have not been enough changes to the property. It is tired and dated. I came to this hotel for a convention. Its location by the airport and shuttle access make it attractive for the event planners. Check-in was efficient and uneventful. I arrived with a co-worker at about 7:30 pm. I was given a room on the 5th floor at the end of the hall, so it was fairly quiet. I did not hear planes overhead as some other people have commented. The elevators did not all work the entire time of my stay. When they did work they were a bit on the flaky side. The room was large as was the bath. The TV was the old school CRT type, not a flat screen. I thought Doubletree was supposed to be a higher end or specialty hotel to distinguish its brand from other Hilton properties. The free wireless Internet access was appreciated and worked well. The room contained a desk and chair, wingback chair, glass top table and king sized bed. The bath had a decent sized countertop so I could place my toiletries and have room to spare. The commode handle had to be held down for a full flush to occur. The shower worked well, although the bath faucet shot water all over the side of the tub instead of into it. The closet was a double sliding door type. Oddly enough the door to the bath was also a slider. Lighting in the room was a little dark, even with all the lights illuminated. A pet peeve of mine is when there is no light for the closet. Guess what, no light for the closet in this room. The thermostat did a terrible job of heating and cooling the room as it was either way too hot or way too cold. My room was set to broil when I first entered it. I used the fitness center and found it to be the high point of the hotel. If memory serves there were three ellipticals, four or five treadmills, a stationary bike, free weights, exercise balls and several benches. The ellipticals and treadmills were higher quality units with the screens for TV viewing or statistics. Although the hotel has three restaurants and a bar, I avoided the restaurants. If the food in the restaurants was as good as the limited menu in Harry's and priced the same it would not have been worth the expense. I walked across the street to Kelsey's and Millstone instead. Millstone is much better than Kelsey's. I did not make the trek to the Montana steakhouse on the other side of the viaduct. I had heard from other hotel guests that the Japanese restaurant in the hotel was very good. The attached convention center was convenient but very small, and in my estimation undersized for our group's needs. The layout inclued dual stairways and a very narrow escalator to reach the upper level, all of which should be remodeled to increase floor space. Actually I wish they would just tear down that portion and redo the convention center completely but I doubt that it is likely that would ever happen. The last feature I will mention in this review is that the hotel has a significant amount of space devoted to retail. It is almost like there should be a casino where the convention center is, as it reminds me of that type of layout. The only thing missing is a lot of smoke. Fortunately Ontario has a smoking law! It seems odd to say this, with all the amenities this location has to offer that I would be so indifferent to this property. I would only stay at this hotel if I had to. I would rather stay at another location nearby, and will again consider that in future events planned for this location.
