The key is that you are basically in the middle of nowhere, aside from the two restaurants I mentioned that are across the street. The hotel knows that you are unlikely to venture outside in February. If you don't have an event at this location, check other airport hotels.

Reviews.Title: “An okay place to stay, but there are better close by”
Reviews.Author: fullermel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two children stayed at this hotel for several hours on a layover coming home from Punta Cana. We arrived at 2 AM, and were greeting by courteous and friendly enough staff. The rooms are a little cramped, especially after a week of staying in a large resort. The bedding is very comfortable. The breakfast buffet is overpriced for what you get, but that is Toronto Hotels for you. Our waiter kinda disappeared during the last few minutes of our meal, so we had to scramble to make sure we didn't miss the shuttle to the airport. PS....the chocolate chip cookies are not only delicious, but the ingredients are wholesome.........nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “If you just want a bed for the night, this will do”
Reviews.Author: DandDToronto
Reviews.Content: My company has its annual dinner-dance here so my wife and I are regular, if infrequent, guests. This year we noticed some improvements in the dowdy, worn rooms, and the smell of paint in the corridors indicated that some refurbishment is going on. Alas the staff are still offhand and uncaring. Making a reservation was very trying. One gets transferred to a call centre in the southern USA where the receptionist had no information on the corporate rate that had been negotiated. Last year I complained about the indignity and reasonless requirement for ID at check-in and was pleased not to be asked for ID this year. Was I lucky or is somebody responding to complaints? The food at the dinner-dance was acceptable for a mass-catered event, but breakfast was poor: the food being quite bland and even tasteless; not to mention expensive. The parking lot continues to be a safety hazard with little attempt at snow clearing making it all too easy for pedestrians to slip. If your room faces the in the right direction (north east I think), the view of incoming planes is dramatic.

Reviews.Title: “We got what we paid for...or maybe less?”
Reviews.Author: N_and_R
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this DoubleTree property the night before our flight out of Pearson to our vacation. We did this since the hotel was offering a very attractive package including one night stay plus parking for the duration of our vacation. The package was definitely priced very attractively. The entire complex is rather large, with a lot of convention space attached to the main hotel building. The public areas of the property appeared to be relatively new and in excellent condition. There were two major problems we noticed within the first 30 minutes of our arrival. First, the people working the desk just seemed very unhappy and it was rather clear to us that they did not like working there. We live close to Toronto area, and we have stayed in a few Canadian hotels around here, I have never stayed in a property with this level of "employee morale" problem. This morale problem was even affecting the airport shuttle drivers. It was clear to us that at least one of the drivers we encountered was clearly unhappy about his predicament to be employed in that capacity. Also, it was unfortunate that the actual hotel part of the property was not the same vintage as the convention area. The rooms (on the executive floor) were rather small with lack of modern conveniences including the wall switch for lighting. The furnishings appeared to be from the late 70's/early 80's. The room was clean and tidy, but it showed the fact that everything in the room were very old. The mattress was not very comfortable to sleep on. Also, something in the room (maybe the heating unit?) was making this constant buzzing throughout the night. We did not very sleep well that night. We know this is just an airport hotel with a great package rate for parking, so we were not that disappointed with what we experienced. Obviously, the management of this property is not that interested in either happy customers or happy employees.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: Jose1313
Reviews.Content: I transferred over from the Hilton Toronto Airport hotel because the Double Tree offered some ammenties I was looking for, These included the indoor pool and gym. These both were excellent compared to the Hilton. Here I am comparing the two and I would have to rate the Hilton as a better choice for the business traveller. The staff at the DoubleTree were not as friendly and the restaurant was a huge dispappoint. For example, at the Hilton guests could get free take out coffee. The Double Tree charges $2.00 for the coffee. The selection of breakfast items was limited. The HIlton had better quality items such as fresh fruits. Anyway, I will probably not stay at the Double Tree again. I just feel that Hilton staff were so much nicer. Also, I could see that the Hilton was working on remodeling their gym and the room were nicer. Last comment on the DoubleTree. I have Gold Membership with Hilton and was not given an Executive level floor eventhough the Hotel was empty.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures are deceiving, but staff and food AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: mum2noah1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a nice little get away to Toronto. When we arrived to the hotel and checked into our room, I was quite upset. The photo's that we displayed on the hotel's website was NOTHING like the room we stayed in, it was VERY dated. We were only at the hotel to pretty much sleep, the bed's were not the most comfortable either. BUT the room and bathroom were VERY clean and house keeping were on top of everything. The pool was SO small, the picture on the web site showed that it was much bigger. The restraunts in the hotel are AMAZiNG. The breakfast buffet INCREDIBLE! Ginko's although a little pricey the food was authentic Japanese, nothing like what you get at your ordinary run of the mill Japanese reasturant. I'm part Japanese so I know what authentic Japanese food tastes like, and it was just like my grandmothers cooking. All in all, the Staff are very friendly, food is amazing and for the price you pay it's a good deal if you are there just to have a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Although problems resolved by guest services, cannot recommend this hotel at this time.”
Reviews.Author: dragonlady06
Reviews.Content: On Aug. 8th, after a long day at Canadaâ€™s Wonderland, my family arrived at the Doubletree by Hilton, Toronto Airport, at approx. 8:15 p.m. We had stayed at this property many times before it was taken over by Hilton (hotel was previously called the International Plaza) and never had a bad experience, so we were expecting same. However, upon check-in, we were immediately told that there were no more double-bedded rooms left. We had an online prepaid reservation for a double-bedded room as well as an online confirmation from the hotel, so we were upset. The gentleman at the front desk, whom I believe was the hotel manager, did not apologize for having given away our room. In fact, he was rather abrupt with us and appeared to be attempting to get rid of us as quickly as possible. He had a heavy accent and was difficult to understand at times. He told us that there was a trade convention on that weekend, and everyone wanted a double-bedded room. He made it clear that we would have to take another room, but he would give us a free â€œupgradeâ€� to a larger room, unless of course, we did not want it (this was said in a belligerent tone of voice). Since our reservation was non-cancelable and non-refundable, it was getting late, and we were tired, we agreed to take the other room. What choice did we have? When we got to the elevators to make our way up to our room, other hotel guests told us not to stick any part of our bodies in-between the elevator doors because the doors were not equipped with sensors. On the way up to our floor, I had to get out of the elevator to allow the person behind me to get out, and the doors abruptly closed behind me. The person that was supposed to get off at that floor was not able to get out before the doors closed, and of course, I was not able to get back in. I was separated from my family until another elevator came along, and that took a while because of how busy the hotel was that evening. Anyway, after finally making it up to our floor, we discovered that our room was located way down the corridor at the farthest possible point away from the elevators. This annoyed us because there were no trolleys available to help us move our luggage to our room (and we had a lot of luggage). Apparently, persons associated with the trade convention were already using all of the hotelâ€™s available trolleys. When we finally arrived at our room and opened the door, we were very disappointed. The â€œupgradedâ€� room was only slightly larger than a standard room, and the lay-out was definitely not suitable for a family of four consisting of three adults and one child (our daughter is 21 yrs. old, and our son is 10 yrs. old). The room contained only a king size bed and a pull-out sofa bed. No one wanted to sleep on the sofa bed. In the end, my husband decided to share it with our son since he did not want the girls to be uncomfortable (very admirable!). Unfortunately, the springs were shot on the bed, making it very uncomfortable. Needless to say, he did not sleep well. He awoke several times throughout the night and finally gave up on sleeping altogether by 4:30 a.m. During our stay, we had several concerns besides the room type. The first pertained to the cleanliness of the room. The cushions on the sofa bed were lightly stained (perhaps from spilled soda pop), and when pulling out the sofa bed to sleep on, we discovered that no vacuuming had taken place under the sofa bed in a very long time. Also, we were expected to use the sheets that were already on the sofa bed, but since we could not ascertain how long it had been since someone had changed those sheets, we did not feel comfortable using them. Fortunately, a very kind gentleman that came to our room to make the bed decided that he was not happy with us using the current bedding either, and he left to get us some fresh bedding (thank goodness!). He was the nicest person that we dealt with during our stay at this hotel. On the morning of our departure, I wanted to make coffee, but there was only one disposable cup under the coffee maker (the coffee maker requires two cups since it makes two cups at a time), and that cup had a dead fruit fly in it. I contacted the front desk, and someone did come up to our room with two new cups right away. Another thing that we noticed was that the hotel was in need of some renovations. For example, the floor tiles in our bathroom were chipped. Also, we noticed that the floors in the corridors were not level (some areas were higher than others) which is a definite safety hazard. If one were not paying attention, one could easily trip and take a nasty fall. As for the carpets in the corridors, they looked fairly new, but they were buckling heavily, probably due to the unlevel flooring. As for the elevators, they are in need of repairs, especially if the sensors are not working. An additional concern for us was the service at this hotel. The gentleman who checked us in at the front desk was not very friendly. Also, he told us that someone would come to our room with extra bedding to make the sofa bed. No one appeared, so we called the front desk. After our phone call, an entire hour passed without anyone arriving at our room with the requested bedding. We called the front desk a second time, and finally, a gentleman arrived to make the bed. At this point, it was 10:00 p.m., and we were so tired that we just wanted to lie down. Finally, more of a disappointment than a concern was the fact that our room was not equipped with a mini refrigerator to store our drinks, nor was the bathroom equipped with an exhaust fan. Our room at the Doubletree in Niagara Falls (a wonderful property!) where we had just spent two nights had been equipped with both of these items, so we expected same at this Doubletree hotel. In the end, when we checked out from this hotel, we voiced many of our concerns to the young lady at the front desk, and although she was not unpleasant, she did not appear to care about our concerns either. She never apologized for the hotel and barely made eye contact with us. As for the unsuitable room that we were given, she told us that it is written in our online hotel confirmation that our preferences depend on hotel availability. To us, this completely defeats the entire purpose of making a reservation. If one cannot depend on the room type requested at the time one makes a reservation, what is the point in making a reservation at all? After returning home, I contacted guest services for the Doubletree hotel. The lady that I spoke with was very nice and a pleasure to deal with. She told me that visits at Doubletree hotels are 100% guaranteed, and she apologized profusely for our bad experience. I believe that she was sincere. In any event, she promised to contact the hotel directly to allow them an opportunity to deal with my complaints (and she did). She also told me that she wanted to do something to compensate us. Although my purpose in complaining was simply to bring about awareness rather than monetary gain, I thought that her offer of compensation was a nice gesture. She asked what I felt that my stay was worth (which I appreciated), and I told her that I would be happy with a 50% reduction. She thought that was fair, and she immediately credited my Visa. Had it not been for the exceptional service that I received from guest services, I would never have returned to this particular Doubletree property again. As things now stand, I will give it another try in the future, but I will give the hotel a little time to fix some of their problems before I returnâ€¦ As a final note in closing, I was told by this hotel that it is their goal to become the busiest convention centre hotel in Toronto. Although I believe that this goal is admirable, and I wish the hotel success in achieving it, I would strongly urge the hotel not to diminish the importance of families and single persons visiting the property because they are also an integral part of the hotelâ€™s businessâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “fine..cookies are a nice touch”
Reviews.Author: travellingangie
Reviews.Content: We had visits with relatives in Toronto and found the airport location no trouble...they gave us a free upgrade at check in and it had this great view of the flights making their arrivals. Some light sleepers may not like it but I enjoyed it. At checkin, they give you these hot, fresh cookies, which are nice. The only bummer is the parking. You have to use the hotel card to access the gated lot and it doesn't always work. It did not go one time for us and the fellow working there didn't seem to care until we engaged him for help. Good location with gas station and tim Horton's across the street.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: knittingwombat
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this doubletree during an event at the conference center across the street, due to overbookings we were given the prime ministers suite at a very discount rate, which was a wonderful upgrade, and the view from the room could not be rivaled the hotel itself had plenty of amenities and friendly staff, plus its pet friendly which was an added bonus although i found some cleaning errors, and the did not inform us that our room did not include breakfast, so when we went to the front desk for the particular voucher that all rooms on our floor got, we were snubbed by a front desk person who was completely rude and impolite, i would have liked them to inform us about this confusion in the first place, but they did not.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trexim
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night August 1, 2009 at this hotel. Very nice hotel and excellent service. Got to the hotel around 8:30 pm and swam with the kids from 9:00-10:00 pm. The slides close at 10:00 pm though the pool remains open until 11:00 pm. They have towels at the pool area as well. Room was clean. Nice, spotless beds and pilows. Clean puffy towels. Just a bit noisy with the planes landing. Got a very good rate. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “A magical night, spent at a magical hotel...”
Reviews.Author: focus_d
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I celebrated our birthdays at the Doubletree by Hilton from July 16-18th. Upon entering the establishment we were warmly greeted by all available staff, which was a great way to start our stay. The hotel room was nicely furnished, very modern and clean. The bathroom decor was also very beautiful. I would like to compliment the Doubletree by Hilton for it's eminent services. All staff at the hotel are very welcoming and extend full cooperation and dedication. We could not have found a nicer venue and we will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacationplanner222
Reviews.Content: The impression of this hotel is very nice, staff is very friendly. My two kids loved the pool with water slide. The room is very clean, bed is very comfortable but the size of the room is a little bit small. I have a problem finding this hotel using my GPS TOMTOM, it doesn't show Dixon Road, instead shows Dixon Street, they are not the same. I am happy for the stay because the staff waived the parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay - No splash pad”
Reviews.Author: canuckgrl06
Reviews.Content: I booked the double tree for $111 for an overnight getway with my family. We have two small children and were looking forward to using the facilities. The rooms were fine, very nice beds, and everything was well set up and ready for our arrival. The cookies given at arrival were excellent and my kids loved them. The hotel is well equipped. The staff were lovely and accomodating to any concerns we had. The pool are was very nice, but we were disappointed that the splash pad is no longer available (although prominently displayed on the hotel website - it has apparently been permanently removed) and the waterslide is only open in the evenings when the lifeguard is on duty. This was a bit of a disappointment that should be rectified by the hotel management. We were offered a complimentary breakfast buffet when I asked about the splash pad, but were not able to take advantage of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: FanOntario
Reviews.Content: Everything from checking in, our room, pool area, breakfast buffet and airport shuttle was great. The entire staff were extremely helpful. We would not hesitate to stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a "must stay".”
Reviews.Author: nik07
Reviews.Content: My husband and family have stayed at this hotel on several occasions, the staff is courteous, friendly and very outgoing. Not only is it close to the airport for going away and parking privledges, it is a lovely spot for a little romantice get away without travelling too far, highly recommend it and will definitely be returning in the near future, the site is lovely and provides all ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Still a very good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: merquisez
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel every year. Never had a problem. This year we got upgraded which was nice. Not much to say. Always a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: violaww
Reviews.Content: We felt welcome as soon as we arrived! The staff was incredible from the get go. The room was very comfortable and felt cozy. Luckily we had great weather for walking, and the bellman directed us to the Distillery District - a must see. The first night we dined in the hotel's Japanese restaurant and it was excellent, almost as good as room service. Overall, this was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: smileback
Reviews.Content: I have held several seminars and conferences at the Doubletree by Hilton - Toronto Airport. On every occasion, I am greeted by extremely friendly staff who are fully committed to the success of all our events. The rooms are spacious and clean and the beds are super comfortable. The location is easily accessible by car (only steps from Hwy 401). A free shuttle is provided to and from Pearson International Airport for easy commute for travellers flying in and out of Toronto. For those arriving by car, there is plenty of parking at a reasonable rate. Naturally, being so close to the airport does mean that there is noise from airplanes flying closely overhead. This is not an issue for me because I actually enjoy seeing the airplanes close up; however, for others, this may be an issue. On site you will find a pool with water slide, a fabulous spa, hair salon, shops, four restaurants, and a bar. The conference facilities are fantastic, which can accommodate small or large groups. Overall, the Doubletree by Hilton - Toronto Airport is a superb choice for business or leisure. I believe there is exceptional value in staying at this property.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: lucky281
Reviews.Content: free airport shuttle, very friendly front desk and full service hotel

Reviews.Title: “Complete Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: JamesII
Reviews.Content: Our dealings with the front desk staff were the most prominently negative part of our recent two night stay at the Doubletree, Toronto. The staff were generally rude, dismissive and unhelpful virtually every time we had to speak with them. It started right from Check in when there was a complete lack of understanding of the upgrades we had booked, who was staying (even though the reservation was madeover the telephone not the website) and lasted right to the end when our bill was obviously wrong and it was apparent that the staff who we were told were the ones we should speak to about our bill had no idea what kind of room we were in. We had an issue every single time we needed to speak to the front desk staff (e.g. being told that we couldn't have 5 in a room when our reservation explicitely stated it was for 5). We were re-directed away from the lounge we paid to access obviously or apparently as there were insufficient staff to cover the volume of business (which should not have been a surprise to the hotel since they host the Anime North Convention the same time every year). The roll out couch was broken and uncomfortable for my sons. The tv was ancient and when we rented a movie, it came with a permanent set of static lines at the bottom. The elevators drove us mad. Two of them were out of service basically the whole time we were there meaning long waits (again this was during an annual convention) and indeed on check out day the elevators were so full that we walked down from the 10th floor and had to exit through the kitchen since the fire alarm was set on some of the doors exiting the stairwells. So, in all I would give this stay a very low ranking for service and satisfaction. I will not be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: juslin
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the doubletree. I was a little concerned from reading the negative reviews posted here but thought I'd try it anyway. We were in the area for a cheerleading competition and booked for a 2 night stay. Our room was on the 10th floor with 2 queen beds. Although the room is a bit on the small side, it was extremely clean and met our needs just fine. Beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was very spacious and clean. I can't recall if there was 4 or 6 elevators but they were not slow at all. Service within the entire hotel was great....everybody was polite and helpful. Breakfast buffet was $15...on the high side but selection made up for it. There is a Tim Hortons directly across the road. Left for dinner as there is many good restaurants in the area. With 3 teenage girls in the room I used the lounge often. Service was good but prices are again on the high side. I needed to remind myself that this is Toronto and priced reflected as such. The girls used the pool area and had lots of fun. I word of caution...there are many planes that fly directly overhead so keep that in mind. It didn't bother us or other guests that I talked to. I will return as I thought I received good value for my money. We paid $125/night. People need to remember you get what you pay for. If you want 5 star go ahead and pay the premium and go somewhere else. Our overall hotel rating was 4 star!

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility but could use room upgrade”
Reviews.Author: lillibac
Reviews.Content: The building is very nice but the room left something to be desired. It was small and musty. Nice exercise room and pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Never, ever again.”
Reviews.Author: easterbells
Reviews.Content: This has got to be THE worst experience in hospitality....wait - any kind of service/product I have ever had to pay for or ever experience in my entire life. This hotel only needs one word to describe it, and that is MOLD. This dated, poorly constructed building seriously needs to be destroyed for the health of the people working within the building, and visitors as well. The room in which I stayed had a very large section of furry, thick mold growing down the wall and around the back of the toilet. When I brought the attention to Doubletree, the matter was completely ignored. The pictures that I took and sent along with my email were nauseating to look at, but they didn't deem to mind. They passed my issue from department to department, all the way up to corporate and back down to the hotel itself where it came to rest UNRESOLVED. I have read other people's reviews talking about mold growth, and musty smells throughout the building and I'm in complete awe that they could care less. They wouldn't even refund the stay on my credit card, but did a full refund to another colleague staying with us who complained of rattling pipes all night long. Apparently health and safety is of NO concern to the Hilton chain of hotels. Would I recommend this hotel to a friend? Not a chance!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: 45DegreesNorth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the airport and I would imagine is used heavily by those attending trade shows at the Toronto Congress Centre (that was my reason for choosing this location). The hotel did not disappoint. Check-in: Very efficient, with an added pleasantry of being given two warm cookies. Enjoy them right away, they are delicious warm. General: lots of elevators so never much of a wait. Room: I was on the 4th floor, which appeared to be a blessing; the majority of my fellow travellers were on the 10th floor, and some complained of some airplane noise (those facing the airport direction). I heard nothing. -Wonderful bed, topped with a little cushion with 'Sweet Dreams' embroidered on it. Light as a feather, but warm, duvet on the bed. Nice decor. My room had two double beds and a chair, plus desk. My colleague's room had one double bed and a pull out sofa, which creates more space in the room. --Bathroom has Neutrogena products. Ironing board, Iron, Hair dryer, Suitcase rest. Something I appreciated a lot - hands-free speaker on the phone - very useful when being put on hold. Nicest aspect of room: Free wireless connection!!!!!! I had just come back from Atlanta where I was at the Westin paying $14.95 US per day. Negatives:I arrived around 1:00pm - boy did I have trouble getting a hold of room service. I eventually reached them but it took a while, after a number of calls. -There are a few rougher details, like when I opened the closet to see a clumsily covered venting installation that can cut in and cause the closet door to move a little - I left mine open a crack so it would not make that noise. I guess if it really bothered me I would have complained. Restaurants: Lots of restarants - we ate mostly at the main resaturant, the Orchid (I think it is called). There is a also the more expensive Alfredos, and Japanese restaurant, and Harrys Bar. I found the buffet breakfast to be nice. Gift Shop: Well stocked, good hours. Amenities: You will find a spa, a very nice swimming pool with hot tub, and a water slide. Great for kids. Also a decent fitness room. I did not use any of this myself but maybe one day (I am going back on business this week). Other services: free printing apparently (I did not use it); a good business centre. I wanted to send a fax but I did not realize that I had to bring my credit card with me to enter into the fax machine - other hotels I could have it faxed for me and the charge would be added to my bill. Other: There is an efficient shuttle service from the airport (complimentary) Our group totaled about 20 people and I only heard positive things, we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Stopover”
Reviews.Author: LastMango
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree offers a great stopover package. Room plus 2 weeks parking and shuttle to/from airport. This is our favourite place to stay on a night before/after a trip. Rooms are large and clean; although bathrooms can be a bit dated. Hotel staff are always friendly and helpful -- as are the shuttle drivers. Several restaurants in the hotel and within walking distance. Our most recent stay was early January and it lived up to previous visits.

Reviews.Title: “A health hazard”
Reviews.Author: MarthaBoston
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference that took place in the DoubleTree at the Tornoto airport and had I not been forced to stay, would have fled the first day. Upon first entering the lobby, there was an unpleasant smell. When getting off on the 4th floor, where my room was located, I saw a large sheet covering one wall. To our horror, when my colleague pulled back the sheet, the wall was covered in mold. It was disgusting, as was the odor in the elevator closest to the wall over the next few days. My shower curtain was also unclean, as were the hallways. Unfortunately, the hotel is in the middle of nowhere. It is not located near the airport terminals, it is a shuttle ride away. And a taxi ride from downtown Toronto one night cost $70. So I did not have any choice but to remain there. The only positive (and there were so many more negatives I won't mention) is the sushi in the Japanese restaurant. Go figure! I would avoid this hotel unless it is your only choice or until they have gone through a multi-milion dollar renovation to clean up the place. Better, yet, they should tear it down and start over again. It is a health hazard.

Reviews.Title: “It was just fine to me..”
Reviews.Author: Pulaskicountytourism
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference there. All staff was friendly and helpful. Anthony the bellman helped with ideas of what to do and directions on how to get there. Conference ran well lots of meeting space. Never was to cold or to hot which says a lot for a conference. Food was good. Dined at the Chinese and Italian restaurants. Received great service and good food. My fav was the italian place. Yes you can see the planes numbers and logos as they fly by the window, but I really didn't notice that much noise. I actually enjoyed watching them. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not my first pick”
Reviews.Author: realsimple999
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree for meetings. This is an older hotel that definitely needs a facelift. It is quite big and the rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable, even though in my case, my room was smelling like cigarette smoke even though they are not supposed to. You can easily get lost in the hotel since there are very little indications of where everything is from the elevators to the conference rooms. They give cookies at check-in which is quite thoughtful. I paid 179$ per night which is overpriced for what you get. I would stay here again but only if I had a better night rate.

Reviews.Title: “Medicore......”
Reviews.Author: hmlax
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at all the Toronto Airport hotels, Sheraton Gateway, Hilton, Westin and Four Points. I will say that this one was very well worn. The carpets were old, the decor was old. If you can get past that, then this hotel could work. This recent trip, this was the most reasonable, so I book it. Dinner was pretty good, and hotel room was spacious enough. If you need a reasonable hotel, then by all means book this one, please keep in mind the airport noise is pretty bad....

Reviews.Title: “If You are staying for the nice pool don't bother!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: whispersoftly13
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed with this hotel at all. We picked this hotel because of the slides at the pool. Upon arrival at our room (Smoking) it smelled horriable and I am an avid smoker. We travel alot and did not expect this from this kind of hotel. Next was our trip to the pool. Were the max. capacity is 10 you are not reading this wrong this hotel has 12 floors and the pool can only handle "10" people. Next was the issue with the lifegaurds if there are not 2 the slides are closed and that doesn't take into effect that the 1 stays on the phone the whole time. It is very eye appealing when you arrive but I would not waste my time. I would rather stay in a motel 8!!!!

Reviews.Title: “another great Doubletree experience”
Reviews.Author: brookl
Reviews.Content: I'm a huge Doubletree fan, and this hotel didn't disappoint either. The hotel is a couple miles away from the airport on a big highway. There is a free airport shuttle service provided about every half-hour. The parking is $10CAD per night for hotel guests; plenty of parking spaces available, and we never had problems finding space or getting in/out of the lot using the room card swipe. We got a room with a queen-size bed facing southeast. We could see the skyscrapers of downtown Toronto (along with CN Tower) way off in the distance. I don't think the hotel is directly underneath the main flight pathway, but there were small commuter-type planes flying overhead every now and then. Anyways, this happened only occasionally and never bothered us. The room was impeccably clean. The bed was heavenly with crisp clean linens, lots of fluffy pillows and mattress that felt just right. The bathroom was very clean as I've come to expect from every Doubletree. Great powerful shower. Overabundance of thick clean towels were supplied, as were nice Neutrogena toiletries. The guestroom was a bit on the small side, but still adequate and packed a couch, lounge chair and a work desk, in addition to the bed. The only real problem I had was that the free wireless Internet was very slow. I was very surprised by the large number of restaurants on premises. There were Italian/seafood, Japanese, Chinese, American, and a nice lobby bar as well. The Chinese restaurant (Grand Chinese Cuisine) had pricey, but excellent, dim sum. Grand Chinese didn't have as wide a range of offerings as places in HK or Vancouver, and it was quite a bit pricier here. But their shark fin dim sum soup, Shanghai steamed pork buns and shrimp rice noodles were just superb. I was hoping to use their indoor pool with two nice waterslides. But the slides were in operation only for a few hours each evening and there always seemed to be a bunch of kids every time I passed by the pool. So probably not the best place to go if you're looking to squeeze in lap swimming on a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EdmTraveller101
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Doubletree Hotel in May 2008 and chose the hotel as am a Hilton's Honors member and needed a hotel close to the airport in order to catch an early international flight the following morning. Check in went smoothly with no errors and even though I arrived earlier (1:30pm) than check in, they had a room available for me as I had requested. Also provided their warm cookie on check in! The room itself had a queen sized bed, sitting area with a sofa and coffee table, a writing desk, and ample closet space if one chose to unpack clothes while staying. The morning I departed I ordered room service breakfast, which arrived on time (as ordered) and was very good. I didn't use any of the hotel's facilities (ie: the pool) so can't comment on those. There are a few restaurants within walking distance of the hotel, including a Tim Hortons, Subway, Japanese, and Kelsey's to name a few. The hotel itself offers a free shuttle to and from the airport for guests and was efficient in the provided schedule. Overall a great overnight stay and was in close proximity to the airport for those needing to travel to and from. If one was planning to visit metro Toronto, I would recommend staying closer into downtown, but if you had a vehicle, it wouldn't be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “need a comfy bed ...”
Reviews.Author: lighthouseboy
Reviews.Content: Being a priceline junkie, I got this hotel for $48. It was ok. Comfy bed, free internet in the downtown business center. Near a little shopping/restaurant area so I walked over and ate at a 'Chili's' style restaurant to watch a hockey game and eat. There was a damp spot on the carpet but didn't notify the front desk. Airplane flying in don't bother me.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the Doubletree standard.”
Reviews.Author: reclermo
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of Doubletree Hotels. I like their value to comfort level and the casual but classy nature of their properties. This particular Doubletree Hotel just does not live up to the same level of quality I have come to expect from the Doubletree name. I was only there for one night, and would have much preferred to stay at the Renaissance just down the street (where I usually stay). The whole property looks very dated and has a 1970's kind of feel to it. The room was a little musty, although the bed was comfortable but small. My impression after checking out was that this property should be closer to a 2 star than a 3 star based on my feeling. Just a note, excercise caution when going to the Perkins Restaurant down the street from the Doubletree for any late night meals. There are a lot of shady customers there after 11pm and we definately did not feel safe. If the hotel had been a Days Inn or a Comfort Inn, I would have thought it was decent, but I expect more from the Doubletree chain.

Reviews.Title: “If customer service matters to you, this is NOT the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: DancinPrincess
Reviews.Content: I am NOT a picky person when it comes to hotel services.....I have stayed in all sorts and never had a problem, yet my experience on New Years Eve 2007 at the Doubletree International Plaza Hotel was my worst experience ever! We had booked a room for four guests for a one night stay from December 31st 2007until January 1st 2008. When we arrived at the hotel to check in we were told that on New Years Eve they have a strict policy of two guests per room, yet we had never been told this policy after our booking (approx. a month earlier) had been confirmed. The women serving us acted as if this problem was our fault and had a terrible attitude about the whole situation. She had said this was the only problem of this sort that they had that day....which I also over heard them telling another couple with the same problem a short while later. I would prefer they admit there was a mistake then try to cover it up. The women at the check in ensured us we would not be charged for the first booking......Well, we were......and the nightmare does not end there...... The hall in the hotel in which we were attending our New Years Eve party was extremely cold all evening (we had to wear our winter coats during dinner) and upon returning to our non smoking room we found it smelling EXTREMELY bad with smoke, which continued all night. There was no one smoking outside of our room so we figured it must be poor ventilation. I awoke feeling rather ill. Everything else was a regular hotel experience.....the cookies we received upon checking in were tasty.....if only their customer service and ventilation system could have been as pleasing as that chocolate chip cookie!

Reviews.Title: “A Typical Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wgconrad
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Doubletree International Plaza during our trip to Toronto and Niagara Falls. The hotel was a typical experience for a hotel close to an airport. I would say the staff did their job, but they did not go out of their way to make me feel a guest. Our room accomodations were average; the rooms are small for the price. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant, so no opinion can be given for it. Overall, we would probably not stay here on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cq1996
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at this hotel through Priceline--on June26 to 28 for two nights. We reserved the room a week ahead for no-smoke because we traveled with a young child. However, at the time we checked in, we were bumped to a smoke room. I asked for the reason, the managers said it was hotel's policy and they did not have no-smoke room. However, I saw several people checked in with no-smoke rooms during the conversation with the managers. The managers seemed NOT care about the harzard of smoking to young children and adults. Their atitudes were terrible. Will never stay there again. Kane from Wisconsin

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: DiamondVacation
Reviews.Content: We were confused about our trip stay after reading all the reviews. After our stay, we must say that this was one of the best stay ever in Toronto. Everyone in the hotel is nice and the waterpark is great. Fitness room are excellent for those who care. Waterpark with indoor slides was awesome and evryone had a blast in the hot tub too. Parking was $10 nightly, but we did not mind paying it for the experience. Someother traveller had something stolen from his car in the previous review. Though the place didnot look such, we always clear the car with anything valuable in sight, no matter where we stay. So Thumbs up for Doubletree. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Price But Not For a Swamp”
Reviews.Author: a_farmer_in_Lindsay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I always book an airport hotel if we have an early flight the next day and always take advantage of their parking facilities (normally, up to 2 weeks at no/little additional charge). This was the case with the Doubletree, which we were staying in for the first time. I had been to this hotel several times in the past for conferences and thought that it looked reasonable enough to stay in. So I booked a King bed in a corner suite for our before-flight night. No problems with check-in, check-out or parking. But the entrance hall/carpet in our room was totally soaked with some fluid, which I assume was water since a storm had just passed through the area. The rest of the carpetting had a few rolls in it and we found some belongings from the previous occupant hanging on the back of the bathroom door (we wore shoes to get to the bathroom, to get across the soaked carpet). Normally, we would have notified the front desk and insist on being moved but it was 11:00 PM and we had to catch a shuttle at 6:00 AM so we just went to bed. Unfortunately, our room had a connecting door to the next room and I had to listen to our neighbour's TV for a few hours before drifting off - not the best night's sleep I've had. I can only assume from previous reviews and reccomendations from friends that our experience was an anomaly rather than the norm. Although the hotel room interiors are a bit dated, we did notice that airline flight crews were staying at the hotel and I assume that they would not normally stay in substandard rooms. However, our experience was enough to put us off the Doubletree - we'll stay at another airport hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Management!!!”
Reviews.Author: kkily
Reviews.Content: I had booked a room for an overnight stay at the hotel for a convention. When I made the reservation, I had put a request in for a late checkout. When I got to the hotel, they told me they would charge me extra up to a particular time. I said that was okay and it was agreed upon. I even called down to the front desk before I turned in to double check the time and price so wouldn't have to worry about it the next day because I would be very stressed out upon checking out. The hotel room itself wasn't the greatest, I've paid less for much better rooms before. The bath tub struggled to drain and the little ledge to hold the soap was about to fall off. When it came to check out time, I looked at my bill and I was overcharged. I then had to speak to the onsite manager and he gave several excuses which had no validity whatsoever, I debunked them all and he wouldn't listen to reason from myself or his employee. He was extremely rude, when I was trying to get him to refund what he overcharged, he just walked away from me. He said he could do nothing about it but he was simply lying. He could do something, he didn't want to. Completely unprofessional. Even though there is a phrase that the service industry goes by, the customer is never wrong, in this case, I was 100% right. This manager exhibited such unprofessional behaviour, even towards his own colleagues such as raising his voice and asking meaningless questions which drew some attention from those around. I was appalled by his actions, never did I see a smile from him. He ruined my stay there. I'm appalled he is a manager. Never in my life have I encountered someone with such a title. Truly misplaced power. BUT there were some very friendly staff who made the stay enjoyable, and they were some of the nicest people I've ever met. It's too bad this hotel isn't better managed.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem for budget-conscious business traveler”
Reviews.Author: h0tmail
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel for conferences but this was the 1st time staying there. Room had good amenities and was clean and neat. The breakfast and lunch buffets are very cheap (around $15) and the food is fine. Free wireless internet in hotel. I called for a shuttle while at the airport and it arrived in under 10 minutes. It is also on a major public bus route. The best part was the price, around $120 on short notice - for a hotel this close to the airport it is fantastic. Do not exepct 5 star service if you want that be prepared to pay $200-300 per night near the airport, but I did not have any problems. I rate this hotel at a solid 3 and 1/4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Tired hotel, better off staying elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: muppetx
Reviews.Content: The international plaza is definately showing its signs of age. While the lobby and such look nice, the hallways and rooms themselves are a little dated. The halls have a very unfriendly odour and the room we had was small and not very well made. The bed had a feather duvet on it but no duvet cover, which defeats the purpose as you can't sleep with a duvet that has no cover on (its itchy and unsanitary). The bathroom light had blown out, and we called to get someone to replace the bulb. They never showed up, and had to call another 3 times before someone came...but they didnt come with a light bulb.... We gave up and went to bed, we had to deal with no lights in the bathroom for our entire stay. At checkout I complained about having so much difficulty in just getting a light bulb replaced and the girl at the desk told me it was my fault for not simply coming to the front desk to get one! Unbelievable. Our experience was definately not worth the price of the room, try the holiday inn airport or radisson if you need an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Always dependable and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CincyOHTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times in the last 6 months. My stays have been very comfortable, and the staff has been professional and pleasant. There are multiple restaurants in the complex, as well as a large pool with long slide, and separate hot tub. The fitness center has weight lifting equipment and free weights in addition to the multiple pieces of cardio. On business I seldom find a better deal than this at a place as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not sports team friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had booked for 2 separate hockey teams for the provincial championships. I know this particular hotel is very strict with security, so I made arrangements ahead of time with a person in charge of booking sports teams.What I needed was somewhere for the adults to go when the kids had to be in bed for curfew. I knew they didn't provide free hospitality rooms, so I inquired about paying for a conference room or something comparable. The person I talked with was very helpful, and offered me a large suite, which he said would fit 30 people. He also said since I had got 2 teams from our area to book with them, he would give it to me at half price.I called to confirm the week before, he said it was all set. He did inform me that at 11 o'clock the radio had to be off and the noise level had to be down. This is totally reasonable. Well I collected money from all the parents from both teams to cover the cost. Thursday night we stayed in the room until around 1:30, then turned in. I also went to the front desk and requested blue boxes and large garbage bags, so that we could try to keep things clean ourselves. Well the second evening was quite a different story. Security showed up and the suite and 8 o'clock and said it was quit time now. When I questioned him on it and said I was told 11, he knew I was right and left. He then returned at 11 and said they had had noise complaints. When I told him we would keep it down, I was informed, that he had a contract that said the room had to be vacated at 11, and that only 2 people were allowed in the suite. First of all, I don't know any hotel that says a family of 4 cannot stay in suite. When I asked to see the contract he showed me, it stated 11 quit time only. He said the person who rented the room to me shouldn't have and he wasn't in until Monday, so we were to leave or he was calling the police. I had to ask all these parents that had chipped in money to now leave. The wonderful security gaurd in the meantime called the police. They came and were very understanding. I told them of the numerous lies this man tried to pull over on me. Of course they could not do anything, as it was the hotels responsibility. When I asked for a manager, I was told they never had one on duty. Hard to believe a hotel doesn't always have a manager on. We had also ordered pizza from the hotel. I was quoted a price for 22 pizzas. I collected the money from the parents, and waited. I was called back by this same security person to say the price was changed, and it was $60 more. I said, I was already quoted and prices and had collected for it. I said for the large amount of the order, we should have been getting a better deal anyway. They were charging us approxiametely $27 per pizza. He said he would send us less pizza then. When I told him to cancel the order, all of a sudden the price was back to the original. We waited for 2 hours. Then we never did get to finish them because we were kicked out of the suite and the key changed. I tried to take this up with the manager the following day, but the customer is always wrong was basically her moto. She informed me we would have to wait until Monday, when we were back home to get any answers. As you can guess, I called today, and nobody was available. Basically what I am writing this for, is to inform any sports groups to avoid this very un-sports friendly hotel. This was my second and last time ever booking here. Very unsatisfactory response from management.

Reviews.Title: “All in all, a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeachBabyNH
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a long weekend at the Doubletree while he competed in the Canadian Airpistol Grand Prix being held there. The bed was comfortable, the bedding was clean, and there were extra pillows. Our room, which included a little sitting area, was nice and clean, and quiet enough for us. The hotel is by the airport so if the sound of jets taking off or landing bothers you, you may want to stay somewhere else, though it was less noisy late at night than in the daytime or early evening. The hotel also charges $10 a day to park there, which we (and our friends, also staying there) felt should have been free with the room. We and our friends had drinks in Harry's Bar the first night but not again, as the drinks were very pricey. We had the buffet breakfast every morning, for $13.95. A regular breakfast a la cart, ends up costing more than that, which of course all but guarantees that most people will go for the buffet, even people like me who don't tend to eat a big breakfast. We did not eat lunches or dinners at the hotel, the prices were more than we wanted to pay. We did have excellent meals at several different restaurants in the area. My only real disappointment was that on the hotel's website and also in the lobby, it tells you that there is free wireless high speed internet access in your room. Because of that and thinking that it would be easy, I brought my laptop computer (with my wifi card) but even after jumping through hoops and much frustration we were still never able to get connected. There is an indoor pool and hot tub which we did not use but our friends did and they found the pool to be pleasantly warm and the hot tub nice. All in all, we had a comfortable stay and would probably stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with this place”
Reviews.Author: Mr.Babies
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable, we used this place for a park and fly, my kids would have loved the pool and water slides. Dont see why anyone would complain about this place its not tops but very nice all the same.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NY11373
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel through Priceline at a decent rate. I arrived at 12:30 PM and was quickly checked in and given a chocolate chip cookie. There is an $8.00 daily charge for parking. The room was well maintained, although the carpet needs to be replaced as it had a couple of stains and is beginning to wear. Other then that everything was clean. There is a switch at the door that turns off the TV. I had turned it off thinking it was a light. I thought the TV was broken. A call to the front desk quickly brought a service person up to fix the problem. To sum it up, this is a good hotel if you need to stay by the airport. They have a free shuttle to/from the airport. The only thing that irritated me a little are the $3.95 bottles of water, saying if you drink it, they will charge you. An employee comes to my room to "check the water inventory", but it seems like all upscale hotels in Toronto are doing this.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but a bit out of town”
Reviews.Author: Bexster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights this June. I could not fault the service we were given (ask for the free cookies at checkin!) or the attitude of the staff. Hotel was quiet at this time. There is a regular bus service outside the hotel to Lawrence West subway which then connects you with the city centre - approx overall journey time 75mins, cost about $4.50 each way. If, as we were doing, you plan to go into town each day this is a bit labourious, but very easy and runs until the early hours. Taxi is about $35 each way. The restaurants opposite the hotel offer good family value - style of TGI Friday and there is plenty to choose from. The ones in the hotel were in my opinion overpriced and a bit pretentious. Leisure facilities are good but note that they are unmanned so you will need to supervise children. Did not notice the plane noise when inside, only when waiting for the bus!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The perfect choice for downtown Toronto. Breakfast, High Speed Internet and great service included. Staff outstanding. Rooms were comfortable, quiet and cool. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stopover Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bill_NY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree on the night before departing for a Carribean vacation. They offer a stopover rate that includes onsite parking and airport shuttle service. Although I paid only the standard rate, I was provided with a room on the excutive level. The room was nicely appointed... the bed had a velvety beadspread, down (or down alternative) blanket, and abundant pillows. The bathroom had marble tiling and high-quality toiletries. A hair dryer, iron, and digital room safe were all provided. The Doubletree is within walking distance of Tim Hortons and Swiss Chalet. Upon returning from dinner, I was surprised to find a maid was turning down the bed and leaving me chocolates! The hotel has a nice pool and fitness area towards the back of the building. The first airport shuttle departs the hotel at 3:55 AM; if you plan on taking it, get down to the lobby early... it's a surprisingly popular shuttle... they needed to request a second one on account of the crowd... since I was on the first shuttle, I'm not sure how soon the second one arrived. Upon returning from my vacation, I waited a mere ten minutes or the shuttle back to the hotel and found my car exactly as I had left it. I will definately stay at the Doubletree the next time I need a stopover hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: singflysmith
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at the hotel during a trip from Whistler to Washington DC. The staff were uniformly friendly, my kids liked the cookies at checkin, and the buffet breakfast included in the room rate was really good. Our only problem was with some noisy people on the floor above us at 4:30 a.m., but about 10 seconds after I called the desk to complain, the noise stopped.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience at the Doubletree!”
Reviews.Author: CRAFTY CRUISER
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Doubletree in November 2004. Have stayed many times before. We like the price, the pool, and the hot tubs. The hotel and staff are very nice. The problem we had was that we left our vehicle in their parking lot(Park and Fly Package) and when we returned from our vacation found that the window had been smashed out and items had been stolen. This has never happened to us there before and we are now a little leary of staying again. This is a gated and supposedly secure parking lot. Not sure if we will stay here again even though we love the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great cookies”
Reviews.Author: celicagts7
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, Nice pool, waterslids and great hottubs have stayed there twice, we got free parking for two weeks and a room rate of $99 very reasonable considering some people on our flight paid more just to park there car. Very clean rooms, recently remodeld compfortable beds, not anything more to ask for, great free cookies when you check in and also a great buffet breakfast. This is the one to pick.

Reviews.Title: “ohh were lovin it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the international is the *bestest hotel ever. Frist when we got in the staff greated us with a warm smile and a bid warm cookie. we went up to are room and there was a bid window where every min. an airplane flew by. Its not nosey. there is a huge pool with two giant water slides. YOUR KIDS ILLLOVEIT. There is a hot tub and sprinklers. We have been here three time and this nov. is going to be are fourth time. Let me tell you that if there is not a shuttle going out at your time just talk to the front desk person. THE COOKIES ARE HERE LA LA LA GO TO INTERNATIONAL

Reviews.Title: “International the only way”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, every year we come to Toronto for our wonderful Wonderland trip. Each year we keep coming back to The International. It is clean, reasonable, quiet, and their pool is awesome! Conveniently located to restaurants and shopping. Our family just loves this hotel and we would recommend it to anyone, whether a family trip or business.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I had a terrible experience once to many. Everything at the hotel was glamorous, except for their customer service. When I arrived last year, I was encountered with the worst, most unfriendly person ever. I still can't believe he is employed there, and to make matters worse, he is a Front Desk Supervisor. He told me his name was Michael, and he was very rude. He did not approch me in a good manner on one of the days I was trying to take a look inside a banquet hall room on the first floor. He was probably having a misserable day, and took his frustration on me. He asked me what I was doing, and quickly escorted me on my way. He is not proffessional and needs re-training. I know that I may not have been allowed to do something like that, but I was just curious. Well, I don't want him to loose his job, but I hope nobody else experiences what I went through on my vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I made reservations here for the Rolling Stones Concert. I came here without having checked the place out, and when my friends informed me of the daily rate, I figured that it was just your average hotel, and nothing more. I could not have been more wrong. The staff there was extremely helpful and courteous, and they clearly went out of their way to make my stay there very memorable. Five stars does not do justice to the high level of service that I received here. I am recommending this hotel to everyone without reservation.

HotelInfo.Name: DoubleTree by Hilton Toronto Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 655 Dixon Road | Rexdale, Toronto, Ontario M9W 1J3, Canada
